loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
El comité "Mujeres Trabajando Juntas" lléva 4 años de formación y trabájo con al Fundación Paraguaya , la mayoría de sus integrantes ya viene realizando una actividad productiva con la cual ayudan a sus familias.
La Sra. Marta es una de las integrantes de éste comité , se unió al comité por la necesidad de tener una forma de ayudar y sostener a su familia, es vendedora ambulante de remedios naturales y tambien realiza reciclaje de materiales como ser alumino , plasticos , papel , hierro , etc. Anhela un futuro mejor para sus hijos es por eso que se esfuerza todos los días para darles la oportunidad de estudiar y lograr un futuro mejor.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de remedios naturales para seguir vendiendo y así seguir ayudando a su familia.
texts.en:
The “Mujeres Trabajando Juntas” (Women Working Together) committee has been in operation for four years working with Fundación Paraguaya.  Most of the members have been carrying out productive activities with which they help their families.

Marta is one of this committee’s members.  She joined the committee because she needed to have a way of helping and supporting her family.  She’s a street vendor of natural remedies and also recyclable materials like aluminum, plastic, paper, metal, etc.  She hopes for a better future for her children which is why she strives daily to give them the opportunity to study and attain a better future.

She’s asking for the loan to buy natural remedies to continue selling thus continuing to help her family.

loans.use: to buy natural remedies to sell.

loans.name: Titomagba Group

texts.fr: Le groupement TITOMAGBA est composé de seize personnes qui vivent dans la même zone. C'est la première fois que ce groupement sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante de ce groupement, du nom de Gbèhouédé Pierrette est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Gbèhouédé Pierrette est âgée de 28 ans et est mariée à un certain Robert. Gbèhouédé Pierrette est mère de trois enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés et tous à la charge du couple. Gbèhouédé Pierrette vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Les diverses charges de la maison sont assurées par le couple. Pour y parvenir, Gbèhouédé Pierrette mène comme activité, la vente de bananes et de l'huile de palme qu'elle produit dans sa région. Gbèhouédé Pierrette s’approvisionne aussi dans sa région. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Gbèhouédé Pierrette sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupement TITOMAGBA, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
The Titomagba group has 16 members who all live in the same area. This is the first time that this group has asked for financial assistance from Alidé, and they have done so to increase their business levels. 

The group’s representative is called Gbèhouédé Pierrette, and is pictured with her hand raised in the photo. She is 28 years of age and is married to a man named Robert. She has three children, some of whom are at school. They are all under the care of the couple. 

Gbèhouédé Pierrette lives together with her husband and children, and the couple makes sure that the various household expenses are met. To do so, Gbèhouédé Pierrette works selling bananas and palm oil, which she produces in her region. She also gets her supplies within her region. 

In order to satisfy her customers and increase her sales and income, Gbèhouédé Pierrette has requested her first loan from Alidé along with the other members of the Titomagba group.

loans.use: To buy bunches of bananas and palm nuts.

loans.name: Demetria

texts.es: La señora Demetria tiene 49 es casada, su esposo se fue al extranjero hace más de 11 años, ella tiene 4 hijos de los cuales todos son casados e independientes todos sus hijos viven  en la ciudad de Santa Cruz, La Sra. Demetria tiene casa propia en la zona de Huayllani. La Sra. Demetria vende verduras los fines de semana, es decir viaja los días viernes y vende los días sábados y domingos, compra por cargas y los lleva a la localidad de Yapacani donde los distribuye y comercializa, con el dinero del crédito comprara verduras por carga como papa ya que esta época sube de precio,  ella  trabaja mucho ya que esta actividad le permite mantenerse, se siente agradecida por la oportunidad que le brindan.
texts.en:
Sra. Demetria is 49 years old and married.  Her husband went abroad more than 11 years ago. She has four children, all of whom are independent and married. All live in the city of Santa Cruz. 

Sra. Demetria has her own home in the Huayllani area. She sells vegetables on weekends. That is, she travels on Fridays and sells on Saturdays and Sundays. She buys in bulk and carries the produce to the town of Yapacani where she distributes and sells it.  

With money from the loan she will buy vegetables by the load, such as potatoes because the price goes up this season. She works hard because this business enables her to support herself. She is grateful for the opportunity being provided her.

loans.use: to purchase potatoes in volume.

loans.name: Ayidohotcheme Group

texts.fr: Le groupement AYIDOHOTCHEME est composé de quinze personnes qui résident dans la même agglomération. La représentante de ce groupement, du nom de Virginie est celle ayant une main levée sur la photo. Dans le but de rehausser le niveau de leur activité afin de mieux faire face à la demande de leur clientèle, ce groupement sollicite pour une première fois l'appui financier de ALIDé. Virginie n’a jamais fréquenté l’école. Virginie est âgée de 22 ans et est mariée à un certain Robert. Le couple a cinq enfants à leur charge, dont deux représentent leurs propres enfants. Tous les enfants du couple sont scolarisés. Virginie et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants et assurent ensemble les diverses charges de la famille. Pour contribuer aux divers besoins de sa famille, Virginie vend depuis cinq ans, des produits vivriers (maïs, farine de manioc) et de l’huile de palme dans un marché de sa région. Virginie s'approvisionne au Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer leur activité et de mieux satisfaire leur clientèle, Virginie et les autres membres du groupement AYIDOHOTCHEME sollicitent un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé. Leur ambition est d’accroître le niveau de leur activité.
texts.en:
The Ayidohotcheme group has 15 members, who all live in the same town. The group’s representative is called Virginie, and is pictured with her hand raised in the photo. To increase their level of business and better meet their customers’ needs, the group has asked for financial support from Alidé for the first time.

Virginie did not go to school. She is 22 years of age and married to a man named Robert. The couple has five children under their care, two of whom are their own children. All of the couple’s children go to school. Virginie and her husband live together with their children, and they both make sure that the family’s various expenses are met. 

To contribute to meeting these expenses, Virginie has worked for the past five years selling foodstuffs (corn, cassava flour) and palm oil in a market in her region. She gets her supplies from Benin. 

In order to strengthen their business and better meet their customers’ needs, Virginie and the other members of the Ayidohotcheme group have asked for their first loan from Alidé. Their ambition is to increase their business.

loans.use: To buy bags of cassava flour and corn.

loans.name: Yakhya

texts.fr: Monsieur Yakhya vit au Sénégal. Il est célibataire et évolue dans le secteur du commerce avec comme spécialité la vente d’aliment de bétail notamment le blé, le mil, le maïs, le sorgho…etc. En effet, il exerce ce métier depuis plus de deux ans et fait aussi du carrelage parallèlement. Ce premier crédit sollicité de montant 150.000 francs CFA lui permettra d’accroitre son stock de produit  pour mieux faire face à l’accroissement éventuel de la demande de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Yakhya lives in Senegal. He is single, and works in the trade sector, selling livestock feed (wheat, millet, corn, sorghum, etc.).  He has worked in this job for over two years, and also works laying tiles.

This is his first loan, and is for 150,000 francs CFA. It will allow Yakhya to increase his stock of products so that he can be better prepared for future growth in customer demand.

loans.use: To buy cattle feed for resale.

loans.name: Dinara

texts.ru:
Динаре 45 лет, замужем, воспитывает 3 детей - школьников. Динара в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи 27 лет назад начала заниматься животноводством. Начав этот бизнес с суммы в 5,000 сом (KGS), на сегодняшний  день в хозяйстве Динары имеется 4 дойной коровы, 10 овцематок, выручка с продажи молока и молочных продуктов составляет 18,000 сом в месяц. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Динара обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 55,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку дойной коровы с целью увеличения надоев.  Доходы от кредита Динара планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства.
texts.en:
Dinara is a forty-five year old married mother of three children. Her main source of income comes from a cattle raising business she began twenty-seven years ago. She started the business with a capital of 5,000 soms (KGS); today, her business has grown to contain 4 milking cows, 10 sheep, and an 18,000 soms per month income generated from the sale of milk and milk products. 

Hoping to expand her business even further, Dinara approached "Bai Tushum and Partners" with a request for a loan of 55,000 soms (KGS) in order to purchase a milking cow and increase milk production. 
She plans to reinvest the profits from the loan back into her business.

loans.use: to purchase a milking cow.

loans.name: Hafiswa

texts.en:
Hafiswa lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is a widow with one child who attends school. She is not looking after additional family members.
She has been selling cosmetics for the last four years in a shop she rents. She sells at retail, working seven days a week. She does not have another source of income.
She has requested for a loan of UGX 400,000 from MCDT to enable her purchase more cosmetics for sale like boxes of cream relaxers, weaves, and braids. Her major challenges include the high transport costs and ever increasing prices of cosmetics. She joined MCDT because she was assured that she would benefit from the services offered. Her dream is to see her business expand. She rents a house with access to both electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of cosmetics like cream relaxers, braids, and weaves

loans.name: Jose Manuel

texts.es:
José Manuel nació en el año 1985 y actualmente reside en la ciudad de Latacunga, en la Provincia de Cotopaxi . Latacunga está ubicada en el centro del Ecuador en las faldas del volcán activo más alto del mundo, el Cotopaxi, que ya ha destruido a la ciudad tres veces desde su fundación. En la ciudad se puede apreciar la arquitectura de la época colonial y sus habitantes se caracterizan por celebrar varias fiestas que contienen creencias de varias culturas como la “Mama Negra” que es una celebración originada con tradiciones africanas, indígenas y españolas.  
José Manuel se dedica 4 horas al día y los fines de semana desde hace 6 años a su negocio de cerrajería y trabajos en metal como marcos de puertas y ventanas así como estructuras para proteger las mismas. Él solicita un préstamo a Kiva para poder comprar más materia prima y así poder  cumplir más rápido con sus contratos y de esta manera generar mejores  ingresos, y progresar en su negocio y como persona. José  De esta manera, estará preparado para cumplir sueños tales como formar una familia o tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
José Manuel was born in 1985 and currently lives in the city of Latacunga, in the province of Cotopaxi. Latacunga is located in central Ecuador, at the foot of the highest active volcano in the world, the Cotopaxi, which has destroyed the city three times since it was founded. The city displays colonial arquitecture, and its residents are known for celebrating several festivities which comprise multicultural beliefs, such as the “Mama Negra,” which originated from African, indigenous, and Spanish traditions.
José Manuel has been working in his business for six years, four hours a day and weekends. He is a locksmith and also works with metal, building door and window frames, as well as structures to protect doors and windows. 
He is requesting a loan from Kiva in order to purchase more raw materials so that he can finish contracts faster, generate a better income, and move forward with his business and also personally. This way, José will be prepared to make his dreams come true, such as starting a family and owning a home.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials.

loans.name: Mariela

texts.es:
Mariela  forma parte del Banco Comunal “Jesus Obrero” perteneciente a la ciudad de Curicó.
Ella se dedica al rubro de comerciante, específicamente a la venta de frutas y verduras, desde hace 9 años. Comenta que tiene una persona que le ayuda en su puesto de trabajo que lo ubica en las  ferias libres, su horario de trabajo es de 9ºº hasta  las 20ºº horas.
Su mercadería la compra directamente en supermercados y distribuidoras de frutas y verduras, ya que son lugares en los cuales encuentra su mercadería a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará frutas y verduras, y agregará venta de legumbres.
Una de sus metas es seguir con el negocio, seguir creciendo, abastecerlo de otros productos como legumbres,  ya que su misma clientela le ha ido solicitando y además para generar mayores ingresos, así con esto optar a una mejor calidad de vida.
Mariela vive junto a su esposo quien le brinda apoyo en su negocio, y 2 hijos, uno de  20 años de edad, quien se encuentra trabajando y una hija de 12 años de edad, quien se encuentra estudiando. Sus sueños a nivel familiar es terminar de arreglar su casa para brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
Mariela está muy contenta y agradecida del crédito y servicios otorgados por Fondo Esperanza. Además comenta que se siente muy cómoda con las reuniones y grupo del Banco Comunal, ya que existe generosidad y unidad.
Curicó se ubica en la región del Maule, zona centro del país. El clima de Curicó es de tipo mediterráneo y es considerado como uno de los más agradables del país. Se caracteriza además por su cultura en torno al vino y sus alrededores de belleza natural.  A pesar de que la fuerza de trabajo se ha  incrementado, esta zona sigue siendo, según el último censo, una de las más pobres del país.
texts.en:
Mariela is a member of the Communal Bank “Jesus Obrero” which is located in the city of Curicó. She has been in the retail trade for nine years, specifically the sale of fruits and vegetables. Mariela says that she has one employee who helps with managing her stand, which is located at the open fairs. Her work schedule is from 9am to 8pm. The merchandise is purchased directly from supermarkets and produce distributors, since these vendors sell their goods at low cost, which is financially convenient for her.

With this loan, she will buy fruits and vegetables, as well as add legumes to her inventory. One of her goals is to continue her business and keep growing by restocking with other products, such as legumes. By providing what her customers request, she will be able to generate more income and achieve a better quality of life.

Mariela lives with her husband who helps with her business. They have two children, a 20-year-old who is working and a 12-year-old daughter who is studying. Her dreams for her family include finishing the renovations to her house so that her family will have a better quality of life. Mariela is very pleased with and appreciative of the loan and services provided by Fondo Esperanza. In addition, she feels very comfortable at the meetings conducted by her Communal Bank, which promotes generosity and unity.

Curicó is located in the region of Maule, an area in the central part of the country. The climate in Curicó is similar to that of the Mediterranean and is considered to be one of the most pleasant in the country. Curicó is also known for its wine culture and the natural beauty of its surrounding areas. Even though the job market has gotten stronger, this area continues to be one of the poorest in the country according to the last census.

loans.use: to buy fruits, vegetables, and legumes.

loans.name: Maia

texts.en:
Maia is 33 years old. She lives in a small village of Kashuri District with her family, husband Revaz, mother-in-law, who is a pensioner, and two children (13 and 15 years old). Both children study in the village school. Revaz is a worker in construction and gets a service fee for his work. Maia runs an agricultural business. In particular, she has a plot of land where haricot, maize, onions, garlic and potatoes are grown. She sells her harvested products on the local open market. In addition to farming she has a milking cow, produces cheese, and sells it in the village. Maia and Revaz work hard; they still don’t have enough income to set aside some savings for purchasing additional needed household goods or to finance the studies of their children. The total average monthly income of the family is 700 Lari. 

Maia requested a loan for purchasing a milk cow and a calf. She will be able to produce more dairy food: cheese, curds, and yogurt. Thus, she wants to expand her business in order to make a good profit. With increased profits, she will be able to finance the studies of her children and purchase household items. As a result of the loan, the family will be able to improve their living conditions. Maia and Zviad hope for your generosity.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow and a calf.

loans.name: Sharifa

texts.en:
Sharifa lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with no children. She is taking care of her mother. 
She has been selling raw and cooked yams from the market for 5 years at retail and wholesale, working seven days a week. She does not have any other source of income.
She has applied for a loan of UGX 1,000,000 from MCDT-SACCO to enable her to purchase more sacks of yams. Her major business challenges include seasonality, and high prices. She joined MCDT to better herself. She would like to expand her business and accumulate profits. She rents a house without access to electricity or piped water. Her major monthly expenses are rent and food.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of yams.

loans.name: Maia

texts.en:
Maia is 35 years old. She is from Kareli District and lives with her family, husband Zviad and two children (13 and 16 years old). Both of the children go to the local school. The family runs agricultural activities. They have 1 hectare of land, where they grow cabbage, potatoes and apples. They sell harvested products in nearby villages from their own truck. Zviad also has BMW vehicle and provides taxi services to the local population. Zviad gets a service fee for the work. Maia is the agricultural worker; she helps local farmers in agricultural activities and gets 20 Lari for one day. They work hard, but still don’t have enough income to set aside some savings to improve living conditions of the family. Their total average monthly income is 800 Lari.

Maia requested a loan for purchasing fertilizers and to pay for workers. She will hire workers, which will help her in farming. After cultivation and fertilization of the land, Maia will be able to sow more vegetables and fruits there. Thus, she will get more agricultural products. Maia and Zviad will sell more products from their own truck in nearby villages. This will increase the sales. With increased profits they will be able to spend more on the family’s daily needs. The above mentioned living conditions of the family will improve.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pay for workers.

loans.name: Edgar Paul

texts.es:
Edgar es un hombre que reside en Latacunga, ciudad ubicada en el centro de la cierra Ecuatoriana. Latacunga es la capital de la provincia de Cotopaxi, nombrada después  del volcán activo más alta del mundo que está que esta al noreste de la misma. El Cotopaxi ha dejado a Latacunga en la ruina tres veces desde su fundación. La ciudad está a 2750 metros sobre el nivel del mar y la temperatura promedio es alrededor de 11°C. Latacunga se caracteriza por su riqueza arquitectónica y cultural, ya que ha logrado preservar un aspecto colonial y es un excelente ejemplo de folklor nacional. 
Edgar es un hombre soltero que desde hace dos años abrió un MiniMarket al frente de unas canchas deportivas. Él aprendió acerca del negocio por su madre, y ahora sueña con que su propio MiniMarket salga adelante. Edgar le pone 6 horas al día a su negocio. Él solicita un préstamo a Kiva para poder incrementar el número de productos e implementar nueva mercadería a su negocio. Edgar ambiciona con poder superarse y tiene muchas expectativas para su MiniMarket y para el mismo. Por lo tanto quiere agrandar su negocio y lograr tener ingresos suficientes para continuar sus estudios superiores.
texts.en:
Edgar is a man who lives in Latacunga, a city located in the midst of the Ecuadorian mountains. Latacunga is the capital of the province of Cotopaxi, named after the highest active volcano in the world, which is in the northeast of the province. The Cotopaxi volcano has left Latacunga in ruins three times since its founding. The city is 2,750 meters above sea level and the average temperature is about 11°C.  It is characterized by it architectural and cultural riches since it have been possible to preserve its colonial appearance. Latacanga is an excellent example of national folklore.

Edgar is a bachelor who opened a mini-market two years ago in front of some sports fields. He learned the business from his mother and now dreams about his own mini-market getting ahead. He devotes 6 hours a day to his business. He is requesting a loan from Kiva to be able to expand the quantity of products he sells and to start selling new merchandise altogether. 

Edgar is ambitious and wants to succeed and has high expectations for his minimarket and for himself. Consequently, he wants to enlarge his business and earn enough income to continue his studies at college.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Tafsir Mamadou

texts.fr: Monsieur Tafsir Mamadou habite au Sénégal. Il est célibataire et a un enfant en charge. Il est charretier. Ça fait plus de deux ans qui’ il fait du transport charretier après avoir quitté sa première fonction de pécheur.  Ce premier crédit sollicité d’un  montant  de 200.000 francs CFA lui offrira la possibilité  d’acheter un cheval supplémentaire dans le but  d’en faire une charrette de transport, ce qui lui permettra  de supporter d’avantage ses charges familiales. Son projet futur est de devenir un grand éleveur de moutons, il souhaite aussi  élargir le nombre de ses employés à travers l’achat d’autres chevaux.
texts.en:
Tafsir Mamadou lives in Senegal. He is single, and has one child under his care. He works in cart transportation, and has done so for more than two years since he left his first job as a fisherman. 

This is the first loan he has requested, and it is for 200,000 francs CFA. The money will allow him to buy an additional horse for a transport cart, which will enable him to better support his family expenses. In the future he would like to become a successful sheep farmer, and he also wants to increase his employees by buying other horses.

loans.use: To buy a horse for his business.

loans.name: Khoudia

texts.fr: Madame Khoudia réside au Sénégal. Elle est mariée et s’active dans le commerce comme vendeuse de savon. Elle exerce ce travail depuis  plus de 10 ans. Elle est membre d’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC et sollicite un crédit de 100 000 frs CFA. Avec ce prêt, elle compte renforcer son fonds de roulement. Ce financement lui permettra d’augmenter son fonds de roulement  et d’accroitre principalement ses ressources d’approvisionnement pour  répondre a l’évolution de la demande des clients. Dans le futur, elle souhaite disposer d’un grand magasin de divers produits cosmétiques dans l’objectif de diversifier son activité et de la rendre plus rentable.
texts.en:
Khoudia lives in Senegal. She is married and has worked selling soap for more than ten years- She is a member of a U-IMCEC branch, and has requested a loan of 100,000 francs CFA.

Khoudia plans to use the loan to increase her working capital. This will allow her to expand her capital and, mainly, to increase her resources and supplies to meet changes in her customers’ requests. In the future she would like to have a large store selling various cosmetic products, so that she can diversify her business and make it more profitable.

loans.use: To buy soap to resell.

loans.name: Milly

texts.en:
Milly lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children and two of them go to school. She is not taking care of any other family members. She has been selling secondhand clothes from the market for ten years at retail, working six days a week. She has no other source of income.
She has applied for a loan of UGX 900,000 from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of secondhand clothes for sale. Her major business challenges include seasonality. She joined MCDT because of timely loans. She aspires to expand her business for more profits. She stays in her husband's house with access to electricity and no piped water. Her major monthly expense is school fees.

loans.use: to buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian  lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is cohabiting with no children. She is taking care of her mother, niece, and brother. 
She has been keeping poultry and pigs and has operated laundry services for two years at both wholesale and retail, working seven days a week. She also supplies chapats and roasted groundnuts to shops and school canteens for more income.
She has applied for a loan of UGX 600,000 from MCDT-SACCO to enable her construct a poultry house. Her major business challenges include seasonality and high prices for feeds. She joined MCDT because of timely loans and low interest charged. She aspires to expand her business to 10,000 birds and at least 30 pigs. She stays in her own house with access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expense is school fees.

loans.use: to construct a poultry house.

loans.name: Dagbemabou Group

texts.fr: Le groupement DAGBEMABOU est composé de douze personnes qui habitent la même zone. C'est la première fois que ce groupement sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante  du groupement, du nom de Célestine est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Célestine est âgée de 52 ans et est mariée à certain Bertin. Le couple a dix enfants dont certains scolarisés et cinq restent à leur charge. Célestine n’a pas fréquenté l'école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Célestine mène comme activité depuis quinze ans la vente d'huile de palme et de maïs de façon secondaire dans sa région. Célestine s’approvisionne dans l’un des marchés du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Célestine sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupement DAGBEMABOU, un premier crédit.
texts.en:
The Dagbemabou group has 12 members who all live in the same area. This is the first time that they have requested the financial assistance of Alidé, and have done so to increase their business levels. 

The group’s representative is called Célestine, and is pictured with her hand raised in the photo. She is 52 years of age and is married to a man named Bertin. The couple has 10 children, some of whom go to school and all of whom are under their care. 

Célestine did not go to school. To meet her needs and those of her children, she has worked for 15 years selling palm oil and, on a secondary level, corn in her region. Célestine gets her supplies from one of the markets in Benin. In order to satisfy her customers and increase her sales and income, Célestine and the other members of the Dagbemabou group have asked for their first loan.

loans.use: To buy bags of corn and palm oil.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children, all of whom are in school. She is not looking after any additional family members. She has been selling sugar, soap, rice, cooking oil, and other basic commodities for the last three years from home and sells at retail, working six days a week. She does not have any other source of income. She has requested for a loan of UGX 400,000 from MCDT to enable her purchase commodities like cooking oil, sugar, salt, cassava, and maize flour for sale. Her major challenges include the high transport costs. She joined MCDT because she wanted more capital for her business. Her dream is to expand her business into a wholesale. She lives in her husband`s house with access to both electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: to buy more cooking oil, sugar, salt, cassava and maize flour for resale

loans.name: Safianah

texts.en: Safianah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with eight children and two of them are attending school. She is taking care of some grandchildren. She has been keeping poultry at home for six years at retail, working seven days a week. She also sells tap water as an additional source of income. She has applied for a loan of UGX 600,000 from MCDT-SACCO to enable her to purchase chicks and feeds. Her major business challenges include death of the birds before maturity and the high prices of feeds. She joined MCDT to get more capital for her business. She would like to expand her business and accumulate profits. She stays in her husband`s house without access to  electricity or piped water. Her major monthly expenses are medical bills and food.

loans.use: to buy more chicks and chicken feed.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 44 years old and is a married woman with 3 children, ages 12, 15, and 17. Her husband is a fisherman.

Gloria has been involved in seaweed farming for 10 years. She works hard to help provide for her family and send her children to school. She has requested a loan to purchase seaweed seedlings, straw, and wooden pegs. Gloria hopes to increase her income and be able to pay for her children's school fees. She also hopes to be a successful businesswoman in the future.

loans.use: to purchase seaweed seedlings, straw, and wooden pegs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a small calf and vaccinations for his cattle.

loans.name: Habiba

texts.en: Habiba sells doughnuts and has done so for 6 years. She is married and has 4 children. She uses her income to support her husband in paying her children’s school fees. Habiba  will use her loan to purchase flour, sugar, and cooking oil for her doughnuts. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar, and cooking oil

loans.name: Abubakarr

texts.en: This is 28yrs- old Abu- Bakarr.  He is married, and has no child.  In 2009, Abu- Bakarr established his Jeans, Bags, Shoes etc. business. He began his business because he lost his Father who was paying his school fees for him to be able to take care of him self. Working 7 days a week and 10hours a day, he earns about Le1,000,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le4, 000,000. Abu- Bakarr requires a loan in order to buy 4 dozens men's jean @ Le 600,000, 3 dozens ladies bag @ Le 480,000 and the balance Le 160,000 to be used as transport. In the future, Abu- Bakarr plans to get a better business, and start selling whole sales and hopes to live a better life with his family.He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy 4 dozens men's jean @ Le 600,000, 3 dozens ladies bag @ Le 480,000 and the balance Le 160,000 to be used as transport.

loans.name: Cirilo Marcelo

texts.es:
Cirilo nació en Colombia en 1968, pero actualmente reside en la parroquia de Rio Verde en la ciudad de Santo Domingo. Santo Domingo tiene un clima tropical húmedo y varia de 18°C y llega a  casi 38°C.  Santo Domingo es el hogar ancestral de los Tsáchilas, que son un grupo étnico que vive en este lugar desde antes de la época colonial y aún mantiene tradición tales como el vestuario y sus creencias. La ciudad está ubicada entre la sierra y la costa y juega un papel importante ya que su localización le hace el enlace de varias ciudades ecuatorianas haciendo de Santo Domingo un punto preciso para el comercio Ecuatoriano. Es más, Santo Domingo abarca la mayoría del mercado ganadero en el Ecuador.  
Cirilo es un hombre soltero y tiene dos hijos, un de 6 años y otro de 8 años de edad. Él se dedica más de 8 horas al día a un negocio de crianza y venta de pollos que estableció hace 3 años. Él ya tiene experiencia en este trabajo desde hace varios años, ya que aprendió de trabajos anteriores. Cirilo solicita un crédito a Kiva para agrandar su negocio incrementando el número de pollos; esto es algo que puede hacer gracias a que su capacidad instalada la permite ya que en el criadero puede tener más pollos. Al aumentar las ganancias de su negocio mejorará sus ingresos y estilo de vida. De esta manera, Cirilo podrá brindar una mejor calidad de vida a sus dos hijos y dar lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
Cirilo was born in Colombia in 1968, but currently resides in Rio Verde parish in the city of Santo Domingo. Santo Domingo has a humid tropical climate with temperatures varying from 18°C  to nearly 38°C.  Santo Domingo is the ancestral home of the Tsáchilas, which is an ethnic group that has been living in this place since before the colonial era, and still maintains traditions such as their mode of dress and their beliefs.

The city is located between the mountains and the coast. It plays an important role, as its location makes it the link between several Ecuadorian cities, making Santo Domingo an indispensable location for Ecuadorian commerce. Furthermore, Santo Domingo encompasses the majority of the livestock market in Ecuador. 
  
Cirilo is single, and has two children: a six-year-old and an 8-year-old.  He works more than eight hours a day in his business raising and selling chickens, that he set up three years ago. He already has several years experience in this work, as he learned it from previous jobs.

Cirilo is requesting a loan from Kiva to expand his business by increasing the number of chickens. This is something he can do because of the fact that his installed capacity allows it, as the chicken farm can accommodate more chickens. 

By increasing the earnings from his business, he will improve his income and living conditions. In this way, Cirilo will be able to provide his two children with a better quality of life and give the best to his family.

loans.use: To buy chicks.

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en: Yaa is a petty trader. She sells onions at Nkramofokrom near Cape Coast, and she has done so for 6 years. Yaa is married to a mason, and she and her husband have 4 children. She uses her income to assist her husband in paying their children’s school fees. Yaa will use her loan to purchase bags of onions to sell. With the new profit, she wants to sell a wider variety of vegetables.

loans.use: to purchase bags of onions to sell

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: In the photo, Ama is pounding fufu. For the past two years, she has operated a chop bar, where a variety of African dishes are sold. The foods she serves  are fufu, banku, meat soup, fish soup, and rice balls. Ama is married and has 4 children. She uses her income to support her husband in paying their children’s school fees. She will use her loan to purchase maize, cassava, meat, fish and other ingredients to prepare the food she sells. With the new profit,  Ama plans to open a restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase maize, cassava, meat, fish and other ingredients to prepare  the food she sells

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama sells cloth and scarves. She lives together with her husband and 4 children at Nkarmfofokrom near Cape Coast.  Ama has been selling cloth for 3 years now. She uses her income to support her husband in feeding and clothing their children. Ama will use her loan to purchase a wider variety of fabrics to sell in her store. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a wider variety of fabrics to sell in her store

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua sells cloth and scarfs. She lives together with her husband and 4 children at Nkramfokrom, near Cape Coast.  Ekua has been selling cloth for 3 years now. she uses her income to help her husband feed and cloth their children. Ekua will use her loan to purchase cloth and fabrics to sell. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase cloths and fabrics to sell

loans.name: Jaime

texts.en: Jaime is a fisherman from Trinidad, Bohol. He is married and has 6 children. Jaime supports his family through fishing. He hopes to increase his income and be able to sustain his children's education. Jaime plans to use his loan to purchase fishing nets and other materials. This will help bring in more fish for Jaime to sell.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets and other materials

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce sells doughnuts, which she has done for 6 years. Joyce is married and has 4 children.   She uses her income to support her husband in paying her children’s school fees.  Joyce will use her loan to purchase flour, sugar, and cooking oil for her doughnuts. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar, and cooking oil for her doughnuts

loans.name: Abdela

texts.en: Abdela is a shoe maker. He makes and repairs shoes, which he has done for 10 years.  Abdela is married and has 5 children. He uses his income to pay his children’s school fees.  Abdela will use his loan to purchase leather to make shoes.  With the new profit, he wishes to purchase a machine to speed up his work.

loans.use: to purchase leather to make shoes

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba is a petty trader and has been selling footwear for 3 years. She lives at Nkramofokrom, near Cape Coast. Aba is married and has 5 children.   She uses her income to help her husband pay their accommodation bills. Aba will use her loan to purchase footwear to sell. With the new profit from her expanded business she wishes to build a shop to enable her to sell the footwear.

loans.use: To purchase footwear to sell.

loans.name: Claudia

texts.en:
Claudia is a farmer from Trinidad, Bohol. She is married with 4 children. Her youngest child still attends school.

Claudia primarily grows rice crops to sell. She earns 3000 PHP per month from farming. She needs additional capital to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. Claudia says, "I hope the CEVI program will continue to help us so that our business and our family's needs will be supported and our business will become more productive."

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Jumarie

texts.en:
Jumarie is a 28-year-old married woman with 2 children ages 1 and 3. Her husband is a fisherman.

Jumarie supports her family by selling fresh and dried fish to her community. She earns about 5000 PHP per month. Jumarie works hard to improve her family's living conditions. She has requested this loan to purchase 100 kilos of fish and 10 sacks of salt. This loan will help increase Jumarie's sales and business profitability.

loans.use: to purchase 100 kilos of fish and 10 sacks of salt

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba operates a grocery shop at Aboadzi, near Takoradi. She has done this for 6 years now. The items in her grocery store are milk, milo, sugar, soup, soft drinks, tin tomatoes, tin fish, biscuit, toffees, powdered milk  etc.  She is married with one child. Aba uses her income to help her husband pay their utility bills. She will use her loan to purchase a wide variety of groceries to sell. With the new profit, Aba plans to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of grocery items for sale

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is a petty trader. She sells groceries and gari (a couscous-like grain made from grated cassava). She has done this for some time now. She is married to a farmer. She uses her income to assists her husband in paying their accommodation bills. Grace will use her loan to purchase bags of gari and a variety of groceries to sell. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of gari and variety of groceries to sell

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en: Romeo is a 54-year-old married man with 6 children. He runs a sari-sari store, or variety store, business in San Miguel, Bohol. Romeo earns 5,000 PHP per month selling snack foods, soy sauce, vinegar, canned goods and toiletries. He works hard to increase his daily income and sustain his family. Romeo has requested a loan to purchase more items to sell. He hopes to become a successful businessman in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in his general store.

loans.name: Maa

texts.en: Maa sells soft drinks at Nkramofokram near Cape Coast, which she has done for 10 years. She is married and has 2 children. Maa uses her income to support her husband in the general up keep of their home. Maa will use her loan to purchase more drinks to sell.  With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Simeona

texts.en: Simeona is from the town of Trinidad, Bohol. She is married and has children. She earns a living selling fish and seaweeds. She also runs a sari-sari store where she sells canned goods, toiletries, and other items. She works hard to increase her daily sales and invest more in her fishing business. She has requested a loan to purchase fishing nets, nylon, and more items to sell in her store. Simeona hopes to purchase a fishing boat soon.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets, nylon, and more items to sell

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua is a petty trader. She sells vegetables like tomatoes and onions at Amoanda near Cape Coast.  Ekua  has been in this business for some time now and she wishes to buy other vegetables her customers request. A loan from Kiva  will be used to buy food items and a variety of vegetables to satisfy her customers. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy food items and a variety of vegetables

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en: Teodora is a married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has had a dry goods store for 15 years. She earns 5000 PHP per month with her business. Teodora works hard to help sustain her family. She has applied for a loan to buy more items to sell, such as toys, slippers, and sandals. This will help increase Teodora's sales and profitability. In the future, she hopes to succeed in her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell, such as toys, slippers, and sandals

loans.name: Maribeth

texts.en:
Maribeth is 35 years old.  She is married and has five children between the ages of two and 15 years.  

She has had a sari-sari store, or general store, business for five years.  She earns 5,000 PHP per month selling spices, canned goods and toiletries to members of her community.  She hopes to increase her sales and pay for her children's school fees.  She plans to use her loan to buy more items to sell such as detergent, soap, canned goods and soft drinks.

Maribeth will use any extra income generated by the loan to buy food, pay school fees and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as detergent, soap, canned goods and soft drinks

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en: Teresa is a 39-year-old married woman with 3 children, ages 4, 6, and 12. She has been engaged in farming for 10 years. She earns 5000 PHP per month growing and selling rice crops. She hopes to increase her income and pay for her children's school fees. She has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. This loan will help Teresa's farm and family immensely.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en: Vicenta is from the town of Trinidad, Bohol. She is married with 2 children. She has had a sari-sari store (general store) for 10 years. She earns PHP 2500 per month selling instant coffee and noodles, chips, vinegar, and other items. She has requested this loan to buy additional merchandise to sell. Vicenta hopes to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional merchandise to sell

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi sells maize  at Amoanda near Cape Coast, which she has done for 3 years.  Esi  is a widow and has 2  children.  She uses her income to feed and pay her children’s school fees.  Esi  will use her loan to purchase bags of maize that she will sell.  With the new profit from her expanded business,  Esi  wants to begin cultivating the maize she sells herself.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize

loans.name: Kojo

texts.en: Kojo produces charcoal for sale at Pra Ewusi, near Cape Coast. He has done so for 15 years now. Kojo is married and has 4 children. He uses his income to feed and pay his children’s school fees.  Kojo will use his loan to purchase fire wood to produce the charcoal to sell. With the new profit from his expanded business, Kojo will produce the charcoal in a larger quantity.

loans.use: To purchase firewood for the production of charcoal

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en: Leonida is from the town of Trinidad, Bohol. She is a married woman and has 6 children. To earn a living, Leonida sells shirts, cosmetics and fruits to her community. She earns 2000 PHP per month doing this business. She has requested a loan to buy more items to sell such as cosmetics and shirts. Leonida hopes for her small business to grow in the future.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as cosmetics and shirts

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia is a married woman from Trinidad, Bohol. She has children who still attend school. Lydia manages a vulcanizing shop. She also sells medicinal products to her community. Lydia works hard to increase her income and help sustain her family. She has requested a loan to purchase a compressor machine. Lydia hopes for her vulcanizing business to become successful.

loans.use: to purchase a compressor machine

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba sells secondhand dresses, which she has done for 3  years now.   Aba is married; her husband is a driver.   She uses her income to support her husband to  pay their utility and accommodation bills. Aba needs this loan to purchase more of the secondhand dresses she sells. With the new profit,  Aba plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more of the secondhand dresses she sells

loans.name: Perpetua

texts.en: Perpetua is from the town of Trinidad, Bohol.  She is married to a fisherman.  Perpetua sells her husband's catch and buys fish from other fishermen as well.  She works hard to increase their income and help improve their standard of living.  She has requested a loan in order to purchase fishing nets and crab traps.  One day, Perpetua hopes to have a stable income.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets and crab traps.

loans.name: Ma. Delia

texts.en: Ma. Delia sells fish for a living. She is a married woman with 1 child. Her husband is a fisherman. Ma. Delia earns 4500 PHP per month selling dried and fresh fish to her community. She has requested a loan to purchase fishing nets, lead weights and floaters. Ma. Delia hopes to have sufficient income to sustain her child's education.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets, lead weights and floaters

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
39-year-old Elvira is a married woman with 4 children between the ages of 8 and 20 years. Her husband works as a farmer and carpenter.

Elvira has had a sari-sari store, or convenience store, business for 12 years. She sells eggs, canned goods, spices and other items. Elvira works hard to increase her income and pay for her children's school fees. She has requested a loan to buy more items to sell such as snack foods, toiletries and canned goods. Elvira hopes for her business and children to succeed.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as snack foods, toiletries and canned goods.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en: Leonora is a 41-year-old married woman with 8 children aged between 8 and 21 years. She and her husband run a fishing business in Trinidad, Bohol. Leonora's husband operates their fishing boat to catch fish. Leonora sells her husband's catch at their town's market. Leonora is working hard to help provide for her family's needs and sustain her children's education. She has requested a loan to purchase fishing nets and ropes. Leonora hopes for this loan to help their fishing business immensely.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets and ropes

loans.name: Lolito

texts.en: Lolito is a 49-year-old married man from Trinidad, Bohol. He is a fisherman and would like to avail a loan to purchase fishing nets and raw ingredients such as vegetables, meat and fish. Lolito also helps his wife manage their eatery. Lolito hopes to have a stable business and living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets and raw ingredients such as vegetables, meat and fish

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is a 31-year-old married woman with 2 children. Her husband works as a farmer and driver.

Marilou has had a sari-sari store business for 5 years. She earns 2500 PHP per month selling eggs, vinegar, softdrinks and canned goods. She also sells RTW clothes to her community. Marilou has requested a loan to buy more items to sell such as canned goods and toiletries. She hopes for her business to become successful in the future.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as canned goods and toiletries

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en: Anecita is a married woman living in Bien Unido, Bohol with her family. She supports her family through her sari-sari store business. She is requesting a loan to buy more items to sell such as softdrinks and rice. Anecita hopes to increase her sales and be able to sustain her children's education. She also hopes for her family to have a more stable living in the future.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as soft drinks and rice

loans.name: Cornelia

texts.en: Cornelia is from Trinidad, Bohol. She is a married woman with 3 children. Cornelia is involved in fishing. She helps her husband sell his catch, and she also buys more fish to sell. Cornelia has a monthly income of 5000 PHP. She has requested this loan to purchase fishing nets and lead weights. She hopes for her income to increase and be able to pay for her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets and lead weights

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en: Cristina is a married woman from Trinidad, Bohol. She has 2 children, ages 22 and 26. Her husband is a fisherman. Cristina runs a sari-sari store, or convenience store, business. She sells snack foods, canned goods and toiletries. She also helps her husband sell his catch at their town's market. Cristina requested this loan to buy fishing equipment and more items to sell. She hopes for this loan to help improve the family's businesses and living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fishing equipment and more items to sell.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en: 34-year-old Fe is a married woman with two children, ages two and four. She has been farming rice for three years now. She works hard taking care of her children and managing her rice farm. She has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. Fe hopes to achieve an abundant harvest. She hopes to elevate her family's standard of living in the future as well.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Shoira

texts.ru: Шоира  интеллигентная и  талантливая во всех отношениях  молодая женщина. Недавно подарила мужу прекрасного малыша. Она  очень любит и дорожит своей семьей. Муж работает, содержит семью, но и она хотела бы работать  и реализоваться. Она с детства любила шить и вышивать. На сегодняшний день она стала профессионалом  своего дела и уже имеет своих учеников. Их национальные и европейские наряды всё больше и больше пользуются  спросом  у покупателей. Её мечта открыть свой цех и расширить свою деятельность. Цель её займа  покупка новых модных материалов чтобы шить и создавать современные наряды. Эта  милая и целеустремленная женщина стоит в начале путы и просит поддержать её.
texts.en:
Shoira is a very intelligent and talented young woman. Recently, she gave birth to a beautiful baby boy. She loves and cherishes her family very much. Her husband works and provides for their family, but she would also like to work and fulfill herself. 

Since she was a child, Shoira loved to sew, stitch and embroider. Today, she's a professional and has several students. They make national and European  attire that is in high demand from their clientele. She has a dream of opening her own workshop and expanding her business. 
Shoira is asking for a loan in order to purchase some fashionable fabrics and make some attire. 
This nice and dedicated woman is just beginning her journey and is asking for you to support her.

loans.use: To buy fabrics

loans.name: Felix Ruberto

texts.es:
Con 15,900 pesos Felix podrá comprar más mercancía así como una tostadora y una licuadora para servír a más clintes en su cafetería. Félix inició la "Cafetería Felito" hace siete años, cuando fue "laid off" de su empleo.
Con este prestamo Félix tiene un doble propósito, el abastecer su cafetería y crear un historial crediticio en la industria financiera formal, ya que hasta ahora simpre que ha necesitado un préstamo ha recurrido a un "loan shark" (prestamista informal.
Félix es casado tiene 5 hijos, todos adultos.Su esposa tiene un taller de tapicería.
En el futuro a Félix le gustaría tener un local propio donde pueda tener su cafetería y el taller de tapicería de su esposa.
texts.en:
With 15,900 DOP Félix would be able to buy more merchandise like a toaster and a blender in order to serve more customers in his cafetería.  Félix started the “Cafetería Felito” seven years ago when he was laid off from his job.

Félix has a dual purpose for this loan, to stock his cafeteria and to create a credit history in the formal financial industry.  Up until now when he needed a loan he always turned to a loan shark (informal lender).

Félix is married and has five adult children.  His wife has a tapestry shop.

In the future Félix would like to have his own place where he would be able to have his cafeteria and his wife’s tapestry shop.

loans.use: to buy merchandise and equipment for his cafeteria.

loans.name: Rosa Escarleth

texts.es: La señora Rosa Escarleth habita en el barrio de Subtiava, tiene 31 años de edad, es casada. Esta emprendedora dio inicio en el negocio de venta de mercadería en general desde hace muchos años. El financiamiento lo quiere para comprar: cosméticos, perfumenes, bodis, cremas entre otros.
texts.en: Rosa Escarleth lives in the town of Subtiava.  She is 31 years old and is married.  This hardworking woman started a business selling general merchandise many years ago.  She wants the loan in order to buy cosmetics, perfumes, body paints, and creams, among other items.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, perfumes, body paints, and creams, among other items.

loans.name: Neyda Alejandra

texts.es: La Sra. Neyda tiene 22 años y es soltera  ella se dedica a la venta de productos naturales dietéticos de una línea muy conocida a nivel mundial  su tienda s encuentra en la zona Villazon,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Neyda  para ampliar la gama de productos naturales dietéticos que vende, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para ampliar la variedad de productos que ofrece, Neyda enfrenta retos en su negocio como mejorar su negocio en cuanto a variedad, ya que existe mucha competencia y va a utilizar los beneficios en la compra de productos de nutrición, su deseo es tener un negocio estable y rentable donde ofrezca variedad de productos naturales que ofrecer a su clientela, de esta manera mejorar sus ingresos y por ende su calidad de vida de toda su familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Neyda is 22 years old, single, and sells the natural diet products of a brand well known throughout the world. She lives in the Villazon area. 

This is her first loan with this institution. She wishes to expand the range of products that she offers. As she doesn’t have enough money to buy these items, she is asking for a loan. Neyda faces various challenges in her job such as how to improve the business as far as variety of products in concerned. There is also a lot of competition. 

She is going to use the money to buy nutritional products. Her greatest wish is to have a stable and profitable business with a wide variety of products to offer her customers. In this way she would earn more money and improve the standard of living for the whole family.

loans.use: expand the range of natural diet products that she offers

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: La Sra. Rosa tiene 45 años y es casada con 1 hijo que tiene la edad de  14 años,   ella se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catalogo y también se dedica a la venta de comida los fines de semana como segunda actividad, ella vive en la zona Juancho y en la misma zona vende comida,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra.  Rosa va  a utilizar este préstamo para capital de inversión para su negocio, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es compra  de mesas y sillas para su segunda actividad que es la venta de comida, Rosa enfrenta retos en su negocio que son el reto que enfrenta es la falta de mesas y sillas ya que esto no le permite brindar comodidad a su clientela y va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir mejorando sus actividades, su deseo es tener una pensión donde también pueda ofrecer sus cosméticos, es difícil para ella dedicarse a dos actividades pero ella tiene ganas de superación de salir adelante y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Rosa is 45 years old and married with one child, age 14.  She is involved in beauty product sales via a catalog ordering business, and she also works in food sales on the weekends as a second business.  She lives in the zone of Juancho and does food sales in the same neighborhood.  

This loan is her first with this institution.  Rosa will use this loan for investment capital for her business.  Her reason for asking for the loan is to buy tables and chairs for her second business, which is in food sales.

Rosa faces challenges in her business, which is to say that the challenge she faces is the need for tables and chairs, since this doesn't allow her to offer comfort to her customers and she will use the benefits to continue making her businesses better.  Her wish is to have a guest house where she could also sell her cosmetics.  It is hard for her to work in two businesses, but she has the motivation to do better and get ahead and make her quality of life better.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs for her second business.

loans.name: Jose

texts.en: Jose is a farmer from the town of Trinidad, Bohol. He is married and has 2 school-aged children. Jose cultivates his land to grow rice crops to sell. Aside from farming, he also sells fresh fish to his community. Jose works hard to provide for his family and improve their living conditions. He has requested a loan to purchase fish to sell and farm fertilizers. Jose hopes to have a successful business in the future.

loans.use: buy farm fertilizers and fish to sell

loans.name: Pinky

texts.en: Pinky is a married woman from Trinidad, Bohol. She has a 15-year-old child who attends school. Her husband is a fisherman. Pinky supports her family by selling dried and fresh fish to her community. She has requested a loan to purchase fishing nets and other supplies. Pinky hopes to increase her income and be able to open a sari-sari store business in the future.

loans.use: buy fishing supplies

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en: Gemma is a married woman with 4 children. She is engaged in fishing and seaweed farming. Gemma and her husband both work hard to sustain their family. Gemma does her best to manage her time between her children and business. She requested a loan to purchase straw, wooden pegs, fishing nets and gasoline. In the future, Gemma hopes for her children to go to college and become successful individuals.

loans.use: purchase straw, wooden pegs, fishing nets and gasoline

loans.name: Geradio

texts.en: Geradio lives in the town of Trinidad, Bohol, with his wife and 8-year-old child. He runs a sari-sari store and an auto repair shop. He works hard to increase his income and save more. He has requested a loan to pay for license renewal and to buy additional items to sell in his store. Geradio hopes to elevate his family's standard of living in the future.

loans.use: renew his business license and restock his store

loans.name: Presentacion

texts.en: Presentacion earns a living doing rice farming and selling fish. She works hard to support her family. She and her husband cultivate their land to grow rice crops to sell. Presentacion requested this loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. She hopes for this loan to help them achieve an abundant harvest. In the future, Presentacion hopes to have sufficient income to expand their farming business.

loans.use: buy farm inputs

loans.name: Virgilia

texts.en: 54-year-old Virgilia is a married woman with 5 children. She is a farmer from Trinidad, Bohol. Her husband is also a fisherman. They have been doing farming since they got married. Virgilia does her best to maintain their farm and take care of her family. She requested this loan to purchase fertilizers and pay for labor. Virgilia hopes to have a successful farming business in the future.

loans.use: purchase fertilizers and pay for labor

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en: 29-year-old Belinda is a married woman from Trinidad, Bohol. She has been engaged in farming for 5 years. Her husband is also a farmer. They primarily grow rice crops to sell. Belinda does her best to help keep their farm productive. She requested a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. Belinda hopes to have a successful business.

loans.use: buy seeds and farm inputs

loans.name: Viterba

texts.en:
Viterba is a 46-year-old woman living with her husband and children in a rural area in the Tambogrande district in Northern Peru. She is an entrepreneur who is now looking to take her second loan with Edpyme Alternativa with the support of Kiva, following a successful and punctual repayment of credit last year. 

Viterba has established a small stand selling 'salchipollo' (hot dogs with french fries and fried chicken) during the weekend, while taking care of raising poultry during the week. On the back of the success of her food stand and the needs of her poultry, she is now looking for a credit of 2200 soles to buy animal feed and supplies for her delicious 'salchipollo'. As she continues to establish a good reputation for her food, this loan is sure to help her continue expanding her client base and consolidating her business.

loans.use: buy ingredients to make food for sale and feed for her chickens

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es: La Sra. Roxana  tiene 41 años tiene 7 hijos que son de las edades de 22, 20, 18, 16, 14, 12 y 10 todos ellos en edad escolar la Sra. Roxana se dedica a la  venta de verduras que se encuentran en la zona Garita de Lima de la ciudad de La Paz,  este préstamo es el primero dentro de la institución, la Sra. Roxana va a utilizar este préstamo para la compra de material de construcción para la refacción y construcción de su vivienda  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es que quiere brindar mayor comodidad a sus hijos, la Sra. Roxana  enfrenta retos en su negocio que el tener que levantarse temprano para comprar sus verduras y la competencia que tiene pero ella trabaja duro muy duro para sacar adelante a su siete hijos que son su única alegría y  va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir comprando cosas para su vivienda, su deseo de la señora es el de ver a sus hijos profesionales y también su deseo para su negocio es ampliar su actividad por ser zona comercial, con otros tipo de mercadería.
texts.en:
Roxana is 41 years old and has 7 children whose ages are 22, 20, 18, 16, 14, 12, and 10 years old.  They are all of schooling age.  Roxana has a business selling vegetables, where she works in the neighborhood of Garita de Lima in the city of La Paz.

This loan is her first with the lending institution.  Roxana will use this loan to buy construction materials for refurbishing and constructing her house.  Her reason for asking for the loan is that she wants to give more comfort to her children.  Roxana encounters challenges in her business, such as that she has to get up very early to buy her vegetables, and the thing that she does well is despite this she works very, very hard to move her children forward in life, as they are her one happiness.  She will use the benefits to continue buying things for her house, and her wish is to see her children become professionals.  Also, her wish for her business is to increase her business to be a commercial enterprise with other types of merchandise.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for the refurbishment of her home.

loans.name: Juan Jose

texts.es: Juan de 40 años de edad es originario de chacaraseca-León,  cliente Kiva,  agricultor se dedica a la siembra de hortalizas y granos básicos desde hace mas de 10 años, además de la siembra también se dedica a la crianza de cerdos para obtener otros ingresos, Juan utilizo el préstamo para comprar  cerdos de  crianza, el cual fue de ayuda ya que las ganancias de la venta de los cerdos la utilizo  para cubrir los costos de producción, invertir en siembra de ajonjolí, yuca y maíz. Hoy en día Juan quiere diversificarse aun mas en productos  con el objetivo de satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes es por ese motivo que realiza el  crédito kiva para comprar insumos, abono y fertilizantes, para invertir en la siembra de hortalizas y granos básicos, el estima que esta nueva inversión será de ayuda porque podrá darle mejor mantenimiento a su cosecha para ofrecer productos de calidad a sus clientes, sus planes futuros es mantener su negocio activo, incrementar su venta de cerdos de raza y ganado para obtener mas ingresos hasta poder ser alguien independiente para salir adelante.
texts.en: 40-year-old Juan comes from Chacaraseca, in León. He's a Kiva borrower and a farmer. He has been growing vegetables and basic grains for over 10 years. Aside from that, he also raises pigs in order to get another source of income. Juan used the previous loan to buy pigs for raising. It helped him, since he used the profits he got from selling the pigs to cover production costs and to invest in his sesame, yucca and corn crops. Juan currently wants to further diversify his produce with the purpose of satisfying his customers' needs. For that reason he requests a Kiva loan in order to purchase supplies, compost and fertilizer, so that he can invest in growing vegetables and basic grains. He estimates that this new investment will be of help, because he will be able to better maintain his crop, so he can offer quality produce to his customers. His future plans are to keep his business going and to increase his pigs and cattle sales, in order to get higher profits until he can become independent and get ahead.

loans.use: to purchase supplies, compost and fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, detergents, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Judy

texts.en:
As a married parent of 2 children, Judy works hard to support her family. She has a fishing/fish dealer business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending.  Judy is borrowing PHP 50,000 through NWTF to buy materials for maintenance of her fishing boat for her fishing/fish dealing business.

Judy has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy materials for maintenance of her fishing boat

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. Josephine  has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys & sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for  PHP 8,000 to buy stock of canned goods, snacks & beverages. Josephine  has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, she hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stock of canned goods, soap, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is 50 years old and married with 4 children. She works very hard to provide for them. Letecia runs a business buying and selling dried fish in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of dried fish to sell.

Letecia has been in this business for 20 years.

In the future, Letecia would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional boxes of dried fish to sell

loans.name: Mechilyn

texts.en:
Mechilyn is married with six children, three of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Mechilyn is 45 years old.

Mechilyn has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 30,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell.

Mechilyn has been in this business for fifteen years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Susana Teodosia

texts.es: La señora Susana tiene 42 años y esta casada con don julio y tiene tres hijos que son de las edades de 12, 8 y seis años, todos ellos en edad escolar,  su casa está ubicada en la zona de Pampahasi central, a veinte minutos del centro de la cuidad. Ella y su esposo se dedican a la costura de deportivos en un pequeño taller que tienen instalado en su mismo domicilio, y los deportivos los hacen a pedidos para los diferentes colegios de la zona y también para los sindicatos de minibuses que tiene varios grupos.  Los deportivos que ellos realizan son hechos con tela pique como material principal, también hacen diferentes tipos de logos de acuerdo al pedido, los cuales pueden ser serigrafíado o bordados.  En esta oportunidad ellos solicitan el préstamo de dinero para el incremento de capital con la compra de rollos de tela pique ya que este material comenzará a escasear por fin de año y ellos quieren adelantarse a esto ya que con el anterior crédito le fue muy bien.  Susana y su esposo anhelan poder ampliar su taller de costura con la compra de una máquina bordadora.
texts.en: Susana, 42, is married to Julio, and has three children aged 12, 8 and 6.  All of her children are school-aged.  Her house is located in the central Pampahasi area, 20 minutes from the center of the city.  She and her husband have a business making sports clothes in a small workshop that they have set up in their house.  They make the sports clothes based on orders from the various schools in the area, and also for the minibus unions that have various groups.  The sports clothes that they make are mainly made from piqué fabric.  Also, they make a variety of logos according to the order, which can be silk-screened or embroidered.  At this time, they are requesting a loan to use as capital so that they can buy rolls of cotton piqué fabric, because this type of fabric becomes scarce at the end of the year, and they want to get ahead of this, and because their previous loan went very well.  Susana and her husband want to be able to expand their sewing workshop with the purchase of an embroidering machine.

loans.use: to buy rolls of piqué fabric

loans.name: Maria De Fatima Elizabeth

texts.es:
María de Fátima es una mujer de 21 años, vive en la ciudad de Chincha, con su madre, abuela y su pequeño hijo de un año, lamentablemente por diversas circunstancias es madre soltera;  a pesar de ser joven ella tiene un gran deseo de superación y muchas ganas de salir adelante; gracias al apoyo de su madre, María de Fátima pudo estudiar la carrera técnica de secretariado ejecutivo; en sus ratos libres le gusta relajarse escuchando un poco de música y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz Chaufa para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia y a gracia a su deseo por salir adelante, María de Fátima trabaja como secretaria en una empresa agropecuaria de su ciudad, ella labora un aproximado de 8 horas diarias, ella se encuentra muy a gusto en su trabajo, ya que la consideran mucho por su buen desempeño y trato amable con los demás.
María de Fátima se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la construcción de su vivienda con material noble ya que actualmente vive en una casita de esteras; de esta manera María de Fátima podrá dar inicio a la construcción de una vivienda digna y en mejores condiciones, así desea poder brindar mayor seguridad y comodidad para su familia.
texts.en:
María de Fátima is a 21-year-old woman who lives in the city of Chincha with her mother, grandmother and 1-year-old son.  Unfortunately, she is a single mother.  In spite of her youth, María de Fátima has a great desire to improve herself and make progress in life.  Thanks to the support of her mother, María de Fátima was able to study for a technical degree to become an executive assistant.  In her free time, she enjoys relaxing and listening to a little music.  She sometimes cooks delicious 'arroz chaufa' (Chinese Peruvian fried rice) to share with her family.

On her own initiative and with a desire to do well in life, María de Fátima works as a secretary for an agricultural company in her city.  She works approximately eight hours a day and is very happy in her work because she is very well thought of owing to her commitment and kind demeanor towards others.

María de Fátima is very grateful to Kiva lenders because, thanks to their help, she will be able to start building her home from solid materials.  Her house is currently constructed from rushes. This will enable María de Fátima to start building a decent home in better conditions.  This will allow her to provide her family with better security and comfort.

loans.use: to build her house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, detergents, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Lilit

texts.en:
Lilit is married and has 5 children. She is 41 years old and lives in Gotokan Daku, Ozamis City, Philippines. Lilit owns and operates a plot of farm land, planting bananas to earn a living. She has been in this business for 10 years and earns PHP 10,000 each month. 

Lilit requested a loan of PHP 13,400 to purchase farm chemicals. She has been a member of Kiva's partner, GDMPC, since 2010. Lilit hopes business much higher development in her business.

loans.use: buy farm chemicals

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is a government employee.  She is married and has 3 children. 

Nancy has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys & sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. She had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell.  Nancy  has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Nancy hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Emelyn

texts.en: Emelyn is 42 years old and is married with four children. She lives in Mialen, Clarin, Misamis Occidental Philippines. Emelyn used her last loan to purchase a motorcycle. Her transportation business has grown up and become successful.  At this time, she's taking a new loan to repair her existing vehicle for better service.  She hopes to be able to grow her business.

loans.use: repair her vehicle for better service

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
For over 3 years in Labo, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental, Edna, a 52-year-old married mother of five children, has made a living through the operation of a retail store selling a variety of food and home-use products. She earns 2,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2007, Edna joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She is now requesting a loan of 2,700 PHP to purchase new items such as candies, Milo, shampoo, soaps, etc. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy beauty supplies for his salon

loans.name: Fortunineza

texts.en:
Fortunineza is single. She is 22 years old and lives in Poblacion 1, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She cooks and sells food in the community to earn a living and has had this business for 5 years. Each month, she earns about PHP 6,000 doing this type of work. 

Fortunineza has requested a loan of PHP 8,200 to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. She has been a member of GDMPC for 5 years. In the future, Fortunineza hopes for her business to progress.

loans.use: buy ingredients to make food for sale

loans.name: Maribeth

texts.en:
Maribeth is 29 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 5 children. 

Maribeth has a tailoring shop that make and sells sports uniforms. She has had this business for 6 years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy textiles used in making sports uniforms.

Maribeth has been a member of HSPFI since 2012.  n the future, she hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: buy fabrics to make uniforms

loans.name: Alda

texts.en: Alda of Malibangcao, Clarin, is married and has 3 children.  She is 50 years old. Alda used her last loan to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Her business is successful and she's taking a new loan to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. In the future, she hopes to be able to grow her farming business.

loans.use: buy seeds and seedlings

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
This is Corazon, 57, resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Alfredo, an oversees Filipino worker, and is the mother of their children. At this time, she is working hard to send her other children to school.

Corazon is a mineral water distributor. What she basically does is buy mineral water in containers from wholesalers and sell them per container (5 gallons per container) at a profit. She also retails LPG for additional income. Her regular customers of her mineral water are her neighbors and the local community.  She makes a minimum of Php500 in sales every day.
