He is a member of the "Lucha y Progreso" ("Fight to Progress") communal bank, whose members work in agriculture ind live in the surrounding area - they say that "Progress was practically born there". 

Pedro Nicasio grows maize. He is requesting a loan to buy seeds, pesticides, nitrogen fertilizer, and liquid weedkiller. With the help of the loan he can buy the best seed, which he will buy in Ventanas. His dream is to lease some more land. The setbacks he is likely to face are pests such as orosco. In his spare time Pedro Nicasio enjoys playing sport.

loans.use: To buy seeds, insecticides, nitrogen fertilizer, and liquid weedkiller.

loans.name: Nadezhda

texts.ru:
Надежда просит предоставить ей кредит для закупки летних халатов. Летний бизнес идет хорошшо, спрос на халаты увеличивается и Надежде нужно закупить дополнительную партию товара, чтобы не упустить возможность получить дополнительную прибыль. 

Надежда активный предприниматель, который постоянно находится в поиске и оценке новых возможностей для бизнеса. Недавно она начала развивать новое для себя направление - продажа туристических путевок. Несмотря на то, что в этом бизнесе очень высокая конкуренция, Надежда надеется привлекать клиентов за счет скидок и гибкой ценовой политики.
texts.en: Nadezhda asks for a loan to purchase a batch of light summer robes for resale. Summer business is always good and there is a lot of demand for light summer robes. Nadezhda wants to purchase a batch of this clothing type to that she can capitalize on the demand and earn additional profits. Nadezhda is a active businesswoman who is always looking for new ways to improve and develop her business. Recently she branched out into a new area - sale of resort travel packages. Despite the fact that there is a lot of competition in the area Nadezhda hopes to attract clients with sale specials and flexible payment options.

loans.use: to purchase summer robes

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena works hard to support her family. She is single and has a bamboo retail business in the Philippines. Rowena has been in this business for five years. 

Rowena has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional bamboo to sell. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional bamboo to sell

loans.name: Domingo

texts.en:
Domingo is from Taguma, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. He is 37 years old and is married with one child. Domingo manages a coconut production business. He has been in his business for three years and earns 20,000 PHP a month. 

In 2010, Domingo joined GDMPC. He is requesting a loan of 34,400 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is 38 years old and is single with one child. She works hard to provide for her family. Daisy runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional grocery items to sell.

Daisy has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from pig fattening. Daisy aspires to save money to expand her business and to send her child to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional grocery items to sell

loans.name: Douglas

texts.en:
Douglas used his previous loan to buy home products such as kitchen plates, buckets, plastic jugs, basins, etc. to sell in his shop. It was profitable and he was able to repay all of the loan amount.

This will be his second loan and he plans to buy more bags of sugar and rice, maize flour, wheat flour and cooking oil. He also plans to use part of the loan amount to buy educational materials such as books,  files, school bags and pens to sell in his retail shop.

Douglas hopes to grow his business and to be able to buy land and build a house for his family as well as to provide a good education for his children.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, maize flour, wheat flour and cooking oil, as well as educational materials to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Cora

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Cora works hard to support her family. She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a sari-sari (variety) store. 

Cora is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy materials for the maintenance of her motorcycle for her transport business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to buy farmland.

loans.use: To buy materials for maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 27 years old and is married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them. Evelyn runs an ambulant vending business which involves walking around selling household products in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years.

Evelyn has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more household products to sell. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more household products to sell

loans.name: Lanie Jean

texts.en:
Lanie Jean is from Macupa, Tangub City. She is 21 years old, is married and has one child. Lanie Jean used her last loan to purchase fertilizer such as manure. Her business has grown and has become successful. 

Now, she is taking out a new loan to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Positively, she hopes to be able to continue to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Mujeres De Callei Group

texts.es:
18 mujeres de la ciudad de Caacupé se han unido con el objetivo de ayudar a sus familias  y trabajar juntas. Ellas son mujeres jefas de familia que luchan por un mejor porvenir para ellas y sus hijos, y que no tengan que pasar por ningún tipo de privaciones como las que ellas tuvieron que pasar.
Juana es parte de este grupo, y cuenta que se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de bebidas, como ser gaseosas, vinos, cervezas y demás. Cuenta que tiene ya muy buena clientela ya que siempre tiene su negocio bien abastecido.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de gaseosas, vinos, cervezas y demás insumos para poder surtir su local con todo tipo de bebidas. Su meta es poder seguir creciendo y de esa forma seguir ayudando a su familia.
texts.en:
Eighteen women from the city of Caacupé have come together with the objective of helping their families and working together. They are women who head their households and who fight so that their children will have a better future and will never know the deprivation that they had to endure.

Juana is part of this group and she relates that she sells all types of drinks, such as soft drinks, wine, beer, and others. She says that she has a very good clientele because her business is always well-supplied.

She is requesting this loan to buy sodas, wine, beer, and other products to stock her store with all types of beverages. Her goal is to be able to continue to grow and thus to continue helping her family.

loans.use: to buy soda, wine, beer, and other beverages to sell

loans.name: Genelyn

texts.en:
Genelyn is 34 years old and is married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. Genelyn runs an ambulant vending business which involves walking around selling household products in the Philippines. She has been running this business for seven years and also earns an income from selling dry goods and school supplies.

Genelyn has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional household products to sell. She has borrowed and repaid 11 loans from NWTF before this loan. Genelyn aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional household products to sell

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 32 years old and is married with four children. She works hard to provide for her family. Jocelyn runs a charcoal retail business in the Philippines. She has been running this business for two years and also earns an income from selling fish.

Jocelyn has requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy charcoal to sell. She has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. Jocelyn aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy charcoal to sell

loans.name: Meteur

texts.en:
Meteur is a cash crop farmer in Nakuru town and has been in the business for four years.  He mostly plants maize as well as beans and bananas.  He is 50 years old, married to Nemama, and has six children.

This will be Meteur's fourth loan, and he plans to use the amount to buy fertilizer and seeds for planting.  He also plans to use part of it to pay the farm workers.  Being a rainy season, he hopes to make more profit, with which he plans to buy more cattle for dairy farming.

In the future, he hopes to invest in large-scale farming and to improve the living standards of his family as well as provide employment to other people in his area.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 62 years old and married with eight children.  She works hard to provide for her family.  She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of PHP 26,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell.

Lilia has borrowed and paid 21 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 22 years and also earns an income from food vending.  She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell at her store.

loans.name: Olga Maria

texts.es:
Olga, tiene 38 años de edad, es madre de dos niños de 9 y 15 años de edad, vive en casa propia, se dedica a la venta de carteras y bolsones, tiene tres años en el negocio, surgió por iniciativa propia,  para poder trabajar y ofrecer a su familia los ingresos para solventar algunas necesidades básicas.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de una variedad de carteras y bolsones, que le permita surtir el negocio y aumentar la mercadería para ofrecer a los clientes, esperando que sean aceptados y que aumente la afluencia de clientes.
La aspiración de Olga es mejorar económicamente con el negocio, para poder apoyar a sus hijos en la educación, ofreciéndoles las herramientas para superarse.
texts.en:
Olga, 38, is the mother of two children ages 9 and 15, and owns her own home. She sells wallets and bags and has done so for 3 years. She started this business on her own initiative in order to have work and provide her family an income to cover the basic necessities. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase a variety of wallets and purses, which would allow her to stock her business and increase the amount of merchandise she has to offer her clients. She hopes that the merchandise would be appreciated and can increase the influx of customers. Olga’s goal is to use the business to improve her finances so she can provide for her children’s education and offer them the tools to succeed.

loans.use: purchase a variety of wallets and bags

loans.name: Nolie

texts.en:
Nolie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling rice in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy sacks of rice to sell in her rice business.

Nolie has been in this business for 9 years. Nolie earns additional income from farming rice.

Nolie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fish to sell in her fish-vending business.

Nora has been in this business for one year.

Nora has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 49 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by farming flowers in the Philippines. Rebecca is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other supplies.

Rebecca has been farming flowers for 15 years.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy fertilzers and other supplies.

loans.name: Nieva

texts.en:
Nieva is married with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Nieva is 38 years old and has two children who are in school.

Nieva has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Nieva requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase fish to sell.

Nieva has been in this business for six years. In the future, Nieva would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase fish to sell.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a farmer in Olkalau town where she plants cash crops such as maize, beans and potatoes. From the income, she has been able to provide for her family's needs. She is 46 years old and married to Benson who is also a farmer.

This will be her second loan from KADET Ltd., and she plans to use it to buy fertilizer and pesticides for use in her farm. With the anticipated income she plans to improve her farming methods by planting more cash crops.

In the future Lucy hopes to grow her farming business and make more income hence be able to provide a good education for her children.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling fish in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to purchase more boxes of fish to sell in her fish business.

Rowena has been in this business for 23 years. Rowena earns additional income from electronic re-loading.

Rowena has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en:
Josefa is a married woman who has two children. Josefa is 43 years old, and resides at Caniangan, Tangub City, Philippines. Josefa owns and operates a farm, planting and harvesting coconuts for sale to earn a living. She's been 10 years in this business and each month, she earns PHP 5,000 doing this type of business. 

She requested a loan of PHP 6,400 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. In 2011, Josefa joined GDMPC. In the future, Josefa wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Edith Lisseth

texts.es:
Edith, se dedica a la venta de meriendas y pupusas, vive con su madre, residen en casa propia, tambien Edith trabaja a medio tiempo como empleada, ella inicio el negocio hace 5 años con el apoyo de su madre.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos  para las meriendas y las pupusas, el aceite, condimentos, quesillo, chicharrón, maíz, entre otros que son muy necesarios para el buen funcionamiento del negocio, este préstamo le ayudara a mantener un negocio rentable y con más variedad para las ventas.
La aspiración de Edith es tener un local adecuado para el negocio, donde pueda atender mejor a los clientes y atraer a nuevas personas.
texts.en:
Edith's business is selling afternoon snacks and pupusas.  She lives with her mother in a home that they own.  Edith also works part time as an employee.  She started her business five years ago with her mother's support.  She is currently requesting a loan to buy supplies for making her snacks and pupsas: oil, seasonings, 'quesillo' (soft cheese), 'chicharrón' (cooked pork), corn and other items that are really necessary to run her business well.  This loan will help her to maintain a profitable business and offer more variety in her sales.

Edith's aspiration is to have well-equipped premises for her business where she can better serve her customers and attract new people.

loans.use: to buy oil, seasonings, soft cheese, cooked pork and corn

loans.name: Mohamad Omar

texts.en:
Mohamad Omar is a 41-year-old married man, the father of four children. He has been working as a carpenter for 30 years. Mohamad Omar was very young when he started working: he was only 11 years old when he started, but he had to help his family to make their living. 

Today he owns his big well-known working place which he has to take good care of in order to ensure it keeps improving. Mohamad Omar applied for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to buy necessary wood for his business, to be ready for new requested projects. 

He hopes to keep on accepting more projects to provide his family with good living standards.

loans.use: To buy necessary wood for his business.

loans.name: Rudy Cesar

texts.es:
Rudy, se dedica a la agricultura, vive acompañado de su esposa, no tiene hijos, pero alrededor viven un hermano y su madre, el proceso de la agricultura lo aprendió desde pequeño con su padre, esto le ha ayudado para tener una ocupación de la que puede generar para su familia el alimento y cubrir otras necesidades a través de la comercialización de la cosechas.
El solicita un préstamo, porque está iniciando el proceso de la siembra para un nuevo cultivo de maíz, se comprara semilla mejorada, abono, pesticidas,  que son necesarios para prevenir el cultivo de las plagas y mejorar la producción, este préstamo le ayudara brindándole los recursos económicos para tener todo lo necesario.
La aspiración de Rudy es mejorar su cultivos, crecer en la producción, por medio de este trabajo tambien mejorar su vivienda, porque es de adobe y a futuro quiere mejorar sus paredes.
texts.en:
Rudy is a farmer, and he lives with his wife. They don’t have children, but his mother and brother live nearby. He has learned about farming from his father since he was small, which has allowed him to have an occupation. He uses the money he earns from selling his harvest to pay for food and other needs of his family. 
He is requesting the loan because he has started the process of sowing a new crop of corn. He wants to purchase improved seeds, fertilizer, and pesticides, which are necessary to prevent pests and increase his yield. This loan will provide him with the financial resources to have everything he needs. Rudy’s goals are to improve his crops and grow his production. Through his work, he also hopes to be able to improve his home. It is made out of adobe and he wants to improve his walls in the future.

loans.use: Purchase improved seeds, fertilizer, and pesticides

loans.name: William Alfredo

texts.es:
William, vive con su esposa y un hijo, él se dedica al trabajo en un taller de reparación de bicicletas, aprendió el negocio como una necesidad para poder mantener a su familia, llevándole los ingresos necesarios, lo realiza desde el 2009.
El está solicitando un préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de repuestos para las bicicletas como pedales, cadenas, rayos, asientos, también comprara herramientas para realizar las reparaciones, este préstamo le ayudara para mejorar el negocio, ya que le dará mayor estabilidad para atender a la clientela y mejorar las ganancias.
El objetivo de William es mejorar la capacidad del taller, a futuro quiere también mejorar las condiciones de la vivienda, específicamente reparar el piso.
texts.en:
William lives with his wife and child.  He has a bike repair shop and learned this business through necessity as he needed to support his family, providing them with the income they need.  He has been in the business since 2009.

William is requesting a loan to invest in buying bike parts such as pedals, chains, spokes and seats.  He will also buy tools for making his repairs.  This loan will help him to improve his business because it will give him more stability for attending to his customers and improving his profits.

William's aim is to improve the capacity of his workshop.  In the future, he would also like to improve the conditions of his home, in particular repairing his floor.

loans.use: to buy pedals, chains, spokes and seats

loans.name: Mburucuya Group

texts.es:
El grupo “Mburucuya” es un comité de 14 mujeres que están muy bien consolidadas, trabajan y se ayudan mutuamente. Estas señoras son de la ciudad de Villarrica, y todas son vecinas y amigas. Se reúnen siempre para brindarse apoyo en sus esfuerzos de mejorar su situación económica.
Una de las integrantes del grupo es Carmen, quien se dedica a la peluquería. Tiene un negocio con lo mínimo que se necesita para poder hacer bien su trabajo, es gracias a su negocio que puede mantener y ayudar a su familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de spray, shampoo, enjuagues, tijeras, peines y demás insumos para poder surtir su negocio y así poder seguir brindando un buen servicio a sus clientes,
texts.en:
The “Mburucuya” community bank is a very strong committee of 14 women who work and help each other out.  These ladies are from the city of Villarrica and they are all friends and neighbors.  They always meet up to lend each other support in their joint efforts to improve their financial situation.

One of the members of this group is Carmen who is a hairdresser.  She has a business with the minimum equipment she needs to be able to do her work well.  Thanks to her business, she is able to support and help her family.

Carmen is requesting a loan to buy hairspray, shampoo, conditioner, scissors, combs and other supplies so that she can stock her business and thereby be able to continue providing a good service to her customers.

loans.use: to buy hairspray, shampoo, conditioner, scissors, combs and other supplies

loans.name: Carla Vanessa

texts.es: Carla Vanesa casada, con 37 años de edad con dos hijos tiene por actividad económica  la venta de mercadería en general, ella inicio como una necesidad para satisfacer la necesidades de sus hijos, el negocio lo tiene desde hace 3 años, en la actualidad ha demostrado que ha sido su medio de subsistencia y que lo ha sabido administrar, el financiamiento lo está solicitando para invertir en la compra de ropa, útiles escolares, cosméticos, zapatos entre otros.
texts.en: Carla Vanesa is married. She is 37 years old and has two children. Her economic activity is selling general merchandise. She started out of the need to provide for her children. She has had the business for 3 years. Right now she has demonstrated that she her business is viable and that she knows how to manage it. The loan she is asking for is to invest in buying clothes, school supplies, cosmetics, shoes and more.

loans.use: to buy clothing, school supplies, cosmetics, shoes and more.

loans.name: Ana Hilda

texts.es:
Ana, se dedica a la venta de ropa ambulante, tiene 21 años de edad, es madre soltera de un niño de 2 años de edad, vive con una hermana, ella tiene dos años de estar vendiendo  la ropa, este negocio surgió por iniciativa propia por la necesidad de tener una fuente de ingreso.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de ropa en variedad de blusas, faldas, ropa interior, esta inversión le ayudara a mejorar la disponibilidad del negocio, aumentando la variedad  para su clientela, este préstamo será una gran ayuda para ella y su negocio.
La aspiración de Ana es mejorar el negocio, crecer en clientela, ya que de esta manera estará asegurándose una mejor estabilidad con su hijo.
texts.en:
Ana sells clothes as a street vendor. She is 21 years old and a single mother of a 2 year old child. She lives with her sister and has been selling clothes for two years. She started this business on her own out of the need to have a source of income.

She is asking for a loan to buy a variety of clothing such as blouses, shirts, and and underwear. This investment will help her to improve her business' stock, offering her customers more income. This loan will be a big help for her and her business. 

Ana aspires to improving her business and growing her clientele. This way she will ensure more stability for her son.

loans.use: to buy blouses, skirts and underwear.

loans.name: Juan Abel

texts.es:
Juan, vive con su familia, tiene dos hijos de 3 y 1 año de edad, él se dedica a la agricultura  sembrado maíz, chile y frijol, tiene seis años de trabajar en lo propio, aprendió de su padre, quien le enseño todo el proceso, hasta el momento cuenta con mucha experiencia.
El solicita un préstamo para la compra de los materiales que invertirá en el cultivo, los cuales son el abono, herbicidas, foliares y semilla de maíz, con este préstamo lograra tener todo lo necesario para prevenir el cultivo de las plagas y fortalecer la producción.
El objetivo de Juan es trabajar fuerte, para poder mejorar sus cultivos, asi como mejorar su condición familia.
texts.en:
Juan lives with his family.  He has two children who are 3 years and 1 year old.

Juan is a farmer who grows corn, chili and beans.  He has been working on his own crops for six years, having learned the business from his father who taught him the whole process.  He has a lot of experience.

Juan is requesting a loan to buy materials he needs for his crops: manure, herbicides, foliar fertilizers and corn seed.  This loan will allow him to have everything he needs to protect his crops from pests and strengthen his production.

Juan's aim is to work hard so that he can improve his crops and also his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy manure, herbicides, foliar fertilizers and corn seed

loans.name: Glenda Esmeralda

texts.es:
Glenda, vive con su esposo y un hijo, la vivienda es familiar, ella administra una pupuseria, tiene dos años de estar en el negocio, lo inicio con la ayuda de su esposo.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de materia prima para el negocio como aceite, quesillo, chicharrón, repollo, condimentos, entre otros  que son necesarios para mejorar las condiciones del negocio y aumentar la capacidad.
El objetivo de ella es crecer en el mercado, tener mayor estabilidad económica para poder apoyar a su familia.
texts.en:
Glenda lives with her husband and son in her family’s home. She has had a stand selling pupusas [traditional thick corn tortilla with fillings such as cheese, beans, and pork] for two years, which she started with the help of her husband. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase ingredients she needs such as oil, cheese, pork cracklings, cabbage, and condiments, which would help her improve her business and increase its capacity. Her goal is to grow in the market and have more financial security to support her family.

loans.use: purchase oil, cheese, pork cracklings, cabbage, and condiments

loans.name: Jose Santos

texts.es:
José, se dedica a la siembra de maíz, vive solamente con su hija, su esposa falleció hace dos meses, José ha estado dedicado a la siembra de granos básicos desde hace mucho tiempo, también atiende la ganadería, con estas actividades ha logrado tener los recursos necesarios para su familia.
El solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos agrícolas, como el abono, herbicidas, semilla mejorada, y otros productos que son necesarios para prevenir las plagas en el cultivo y fortalecer el crecimiento, para aumentar la producción, este préstamo le dará los recursos económicos necesarios.
Su objetivo es mantener la actividad agrícola aumentando las cosechas, ya que esto también le ayudara para poder comercializarlas.
texts.en:
José grows corn. He lives alone with hie daughter; his wife dies two months ago. Jose has grown basic grains for awhile. He also has cattle. With these activities, he has been able to have the necessary resources for his family.

He is asking for this loan to buy agricultural materials such as fertilizer, herbicides, improved seeds, and other products needed to prevent diseases to his crop and fortify its growth and increase production. This loan will give him the necessary financial resources.

His objective is to keep his agricultural activity, increasing his harvests, since this will help him bring them to market.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicides, and improved seeds.

loans.name: Joffre Antonio

texts.es:
Joffre Antonio   tiene 41 años de estado civil unión libre tiene dos hijos, vive con la esposa y con los hijos en Ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC EL RECREO, se encuentra ubicada en el sector del recinto San Vicente las lomas, Perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores pecuarias y agrícolas.

Joffre Antonio se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y fréjol. Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, abonos orgánicos, químico. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar buena semillas.

Las compras  y las ventas lo harán en Ventanas. El sueño es poder darles el estudio a los hijos. En el tiempo libre le gusta estar con los amigos.
texts.en:
Joffre Antonio is 41 years old and lives with his common-law wife and two children in Ventanas, in los Ríos province.

He is a member of the El Recreo community bank which is located in San Vicente Las Lomas, in Ventanas canton.  The members of this community bank work in farming and livestock raising.

Joffre Antonio is a farmer who grows corn and beans.  He is requesting this loan to buy seeds, organic fertilizers and chemical fertilizers.  With the help of this loan, he will be able to buy good seeds.  He will make his purchases and sales in Ventanas.

Joffre Antonio's dream is to be able to provide his children with an education.  In his free time he enjoys spending time with his friends.

loans.use: to buy seeds, organic fertilizers and chemical fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers, herbicides and insecticides

loans.name: Daniel Santos

texts.es:
Daniel, vive con su esposa y dos hijos, él es agricultor, albañil y tambien motorista, aprendió sus quehaceres por cuenta propia, tiene 5 años dedicándose a estas actividades de las que ha logrado tener los recursos para la familia.
El solicita un préstamo porque está iniciando la siembra de maíz, para ello debe aplicarle los insumos necesarios como el abono, herbicidas, pesticidas y pago de alquiler del terreno, este préstamo le ayudara a tener los recursos económicos y poder invertir en lo mas necesario con el fin de tener una cosecha sana.
La aspiración de Daniel es mejorar su hogar, sus cultivos y poder agregar algo nuevo en sus tierras, para tener un nuevo cultivo.
texts.en:
Daniel lives with his wife and two kids. He is a farmer, bricklayer, and motorcycle driver. He learned these trades by himself and has worked in these fields for five years.  Through these trades, he has been able to earn an income for his family.

He is requesting a loan because he is starting to plant corn. He needs to pay rent on his fields and apply fertilizer, herbicides, and pesticides. The loan will give him the financial resources to invest in what he needs most to have a healthy crop. Daniel’s goals are to improve his home, his crop, and be able to add something new to his fields to have a new crop.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer, herbicide, and pesticide, and pay rent on his land.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma es una mujer muy trabajadora, a sus 66 años tiene mucha alegría y ella nos comenta que tiene el espíritu de una joven de 20, vive en la lindísima ciudad de Pucallpa, ciudad ubicada en la selva de nuestro país y la cual se caracteriza por tener una flora y fauna impresionante, se caracteriza además por sus platillos típicos, los cuales son muy deliciosos y sobre todo porque uno puede apreciar lo maravillosos de la naturaleza y puede desconectarse del bullicio de la ciudad.  Norma es muy creativa y sobre todo tiene una muy buena sazón para la preparación de los platillos típicos de su ciudad por ello la comida que más le gusta es el riquísimo “Juane”, el cual contiene arroz, carne de gallina, huevo sancochado y aceituna, esta preparación está envuelta en hojas de plátano, es muy delicioso y agradable, así también en su tiempo libre le gusta mucho salir a pasear con su familia ya que está casada y junto a su esposo es madre de una  hija la cual es mayor de edad y quien la ayuda en su negocio. Norma solo estudio hasta el tercer grado de educación primaria, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar para ser Chef ya que le encanta cocinar.

Con mucho entusiasmo Norma trabaja en su negocio de venta de tamales en horas de la tarde y también tiene su negocio de alquiler de cuartos , Norma es muy trabajadora, se dedica a sus pequeños negocios alrededor de 9 horas al día, su hija la apoya con la venta de los tamales en su centro de trabajo y norma se encarga de la preparación y la atención a los clientes a quienes les alquila sus cuartos, ella cree que el va bien en sus negocio porque es muy amable con los clientes y sobre todo es respetuosa y tiene muy buena sazón para la preparación de sus tamales.

Norma está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella para realizar mejoras en las habitaciones que alquila como pintado, compra de sabanas, mejoramiento de pisos , mejoramiento de puertas, entre otros, así de esta manera podrá ofrecer una mejora atención a  sus clientes los cuales en su mayoría son turistas y tendrán una mejor impresión de su ciudad, asimismo mejorara sus ingresos y de esta manera mejorar su calidad de vida, para si poder seguir trabajando y luchar para ver hecho realidad sus más grande sueño: “ Apoyar a su hija para que  termine su carrera y poder tener una mejor calidad de vida”.
texts.en:
Norma is a very hard-working woman.  At 66 years of age, she is very cheerful and tells us that she has the spirit of a 20 year old.  She lives in the beautiful town of Pucallpa, a town which is located in the jungle and is noted for its impressive flora and fauna.  It is also known for its traditional dishes which are delicious.  Above all, it is well known because it is a place where it is possible to appreciate the marvels of nature and disconnect from the hustle and bustle of the city.  

Norma is very creative and the traditional dishes from her town that she prepares taste really good.  Her favorite meal is 'Juanes' which is a dish that contains rice, chicken, hard-boiled egg and tuna.  This mixture is wrapped in banana leaves and it is delicious.  In her free time Norma really enjoys going for walks with her family.  Norma is married and has a grown-up daughter who helps her in her business.  Norma only studied up to the third year of her primary education but she would have liked to have gone on to study to become a chef because she loves cooking.

Norma works in her tamale business in the afternoon/evening with a lot of enthusiasm. She also has a business renting out rooms.  Norma is very hard working and works around 9 hours a day in her small businesses.  Her daughter supports her with her tamale sales in her workplace and Norma takes care of preparing the food and serving the customers who rent her rooms.  She believes that her businesses are doing well because she is kind to her customers and, above all, respectful.  Also, her tamales taste very good.

Norma is very grateful to Kiva lenders because, thanks to their help, she is able to make some improvements to her rental rooms such as painting them, buying sheets, improving the flooring, improving the doors, etc.  This will enable her to offer her customers a better service.  Most of her customers are tourists and they will have a better impression of her town.  Norma will also be able to improve her income and, thereby, her quality of life.  She will be able to continue working hard in order to achieve her biggest dream: to support her daughter so that she can finish her degree and enjoy a better quality of life.

loans.use: to make improvements to her rental rooms

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr: Madame Akossiwa  est mère au foyer. Elle a 02 enfants dont 01 est scolarisé et son conjoint est transitaire. Margé l’âge avancé de madame Akossiwa, elle continue par vendre des habits (activité qu’elle a commencé en 1988) au marché. Elle sollicite un premier prêt de WAGES pour acheter des habits afin de mieux répondre aux besoins des clients en cette période de vacances. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité en l’agrandissant et créer d’autres points de vente. Son désir est de voir ses enfants grandir dans de bonnes conditions.
texts.en: Mrs. Akossiwa is a stay at home mother.  She has 2 children, one of whom attends school, and her husband is a transit agent.  In spite of her advanced age, Mrs. Akossiwa continues to sell clothing (a business she started in 1988) at the market.  She is requesting her first loan through WAGES to buy clothing in order to better meet her customers' needs during this vacation season.  She wants to reinvest in her business and to create other points of sale.  Her desire is to see her children grow up in good conditions.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 39 years old and married with two children.

Vilma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a spice retail business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of spices to sell.

Vilma has borrowed and paid for three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the spice retail business for 10 years and also earns an income from a mobile grocery business.

Vilma aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college. This is her second loan from Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks of spices to sell.

loans.name: Wilberto

texts.es:
Wilberto, es agricultor y empleado, vive con su esposa y sus hijos, él aprendió la agricultura con su padre, quien le enseño todo el proceso, tiene 12 años de estar realizándolo para su familia, actualmente inicia su labor en la siembra de la milpa.
Él  está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de los insumos agrícolas, que son necesarios para prevenir al cultivo de las plagas, como los herbicidas, abono, insecticidas, con todo esto estará preparado para iniciar su trabajo y para poder tener una mejor producción.
Su objetivo es mejorar su trabajo, siendo más productivas sus tierras,  además sembrar hortalizas para aumentar su trabajo y las posibilidades de mejorar su economía.
texts.en:
Wilberto is a farmer and an employee. He lives with his wife and children.  

Wilberto learned how to farm from his father, who taught him the whole process.  He has been farming for his family for 12 years.  Wilberto is currently starting to sow his crops.  He is requesting a loan to buy the farm supplies he needs to protect his crops from pests.  He will buy herbicides, fertilizers and insecticides.  This will ensure that he is prepared to start his work and he will be able to enjoy a better production.  His aim is to improve his work, make his land more productive and start sowing vegetables in order to increase his business and his possibilities of improving his financial situation.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies (herbicides, fertilizers and insecticides)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more dried fish to sell

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a used clothing business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy more stock to sell for her used clothing business.

NWTF is relisting Josephine's business profile in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes to sell.

loans.name: Felipe Francisco

texts.es:
Felipe Francisco tiene 46 años de edad vive en Unión Libre tiene dos hijos, vive con la esposa y con los hijos en ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC EL RECREO, se encuentra ubicada en el sector del recinto San Vicente las lomas, Perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores pecuarias y agrícolas.

Felipe Francisco se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, fréjol. Solicita el crédito para comprar semilla, urea, insecticidas, líquido para la maleza.

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario. Las compras lo harán en Ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

El sueño es poder comprar lo necesario para los cultivos. En el tiempo libre le gusta jugar y practicar el deporte.
texts.en:
Felipe Francisco is 46 years old and lives with his common-law wife and two children in Ventanas, in los Ríos province.

He is a member of the 'El Recreo' community bank which is located in San Vicente Las Lomas, in Ventanas canton.  The members of this community bank work in farming and livestock raising.

Felipe Francisco is a farmer who grows corn and beans.  He is requesting this loan to buy seeds, urea, insecticides and liquid weedkiller.  With the help of this loan he will be able to buy everything he needs.  He will make his purchases in Ventanas, in los Ríos province.

Felipe Francisco's dream is to be able to buy what he needs for his crops.  In his free time he enjoys playing and practicing sports.

loans.use: to buy seeds, urea, insecticides and liquid weedkiller

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
This is Linda, 60, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Merlito, and mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Linda operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 15,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Linda hopes to be able to expand soon and to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Analisa

texts.en:
Analisa is 31 years old and single.

Analisa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a electronic re-loading business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional load for her business.

Analisa has borrowed and paid for 14 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the electronic re-loading for five years and also earns an income from farming sugarcane.

Analisa aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional load for her phone-reloading business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, detergent and beverages

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en: Vivian is married with three children. Vivian is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is a farmer and manages coconut and banana production to earn a living. She has been doing this for 10 years and every month she earn 4,000 PHP from this work. She has requested a loan of 5,600 PHP to purchase farm chemicals. Vivian became a member of GDMPC in 2011. In the future, Vivian hopes to see her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase farm chemicals.

loans.name: Berta De La Concepcion

texts.es: Berta de la concepcion, casada de 63 años de edad,  con tres hijos mayores, tiene por actividad economica  una pulperia ubicada en su casa de habitacion , esta emprendedora incio con esta herramienta hace muchos años por la necesita que tenia de tener un ingresos para su familia, en la actualidad sigue luchado por el pan de cada dia junto a su negocio el cual le ha sido rentable por mucho años, el financiamiento lo esta solicitando para invertir en productos de consumo diario como:  frijoles, azucar, pan, leche de vaca, leche de bolsas, jugos naturales, gaseosas,  caramelos, churritos, entre otros.
texts.en: Berta de la Concepción is 63 years old, married and has three grown-up children.  Her business is a grocery store which is located in her home.  This entrepreneur started her business a long time ago because she needed to make income for her family.  She continues working hard in her business, which has been profitable for many years, to provide for herself on a daily basis.  She is requesting this loan to invest in buying basic household products such as beans, sugar, bread, cows' milk, powdered milk, natural juices, soda, candies, churritos, etc.

loans.use: to buy beans, sugar, bread, cows' milk, powdered milk, natural juices, soda, candies, churritos, etc.

loans.name: Ercilio

texts.es:
Ercilio tiene 59 años de edad, vive en la linda y maravillosas ciudad de Pucallpa, ciudad ubicada en la selva de nuestro país y la cual se caracteriza por tener una flora y fauna impresionante, se caracteriza además por sus platillos típicos, los cuales son muy deliciosos y sobre todo porque uno puede apreciar lo maravillosos de la naturaleza y puede desconectarse del bullicio de la ciudad. Ercilio es muy alegre y sobre todo trabajador pero cuando dispone de un tiempo libre le gusta disfrutarlo paseando con su familia ya que él es casado y junto a su esposa tiene 3 maravillosos hijos cuyas edades comprenden en 11, 15 y 22 años a quienes ama muchísimo y son su razón de vivir y su motivo para seguir esforzándose cada día para poder darles lo mejor y sean personas de bien. Como buen peruano le gusta mucho la comida típica de nuestro país por ello su platillo favorito es el riquísimo “Tallarín con pollo”. Debido a los pocos recursos económicos de sus padres el solo tuvo estudios secundarios pero le hubiera gustado estudiar Mecánica automotriz.

Con mucho esfuerzo Ercilio trabaja en su negocio de transporte de pasajeros en bote, el trabaja en su negocio desde hace ya varios meses ya que veía la necesidad de los pobladores para transportarse porque solo se puede hacer por el rio, el trabaja en su negocio alrededor de 10 horas diarias y puede atender hasta 45 clientes el día; el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable con los clientes y sobre todo porque siempre tiene mucho cuidado cuando transporta a los pasajeros.

Ercilio está muy agradecido y feliz con la ayuda que le han brindado los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comparar un nuevo bote ya que el que tiene actualmente se encuentra un poco viejo y sobre todo porque quiere dar una mejor atención a sus clientes y más seguridad, así de esta manera el podrá transportar a sus clientes de manera muy segura y podrá mejorar sus ingresos y sobre podrá seguir luchando para hacer realidad sus más grande sueño:” “Darle una profesión a sus hijos y que sientan mucho orgullo por él”.
texts.en:
Ercilio is 59 years old. He lives in the beautiful and wonderful city of Pucallpa, a city located in the forests of our nation and which is characterized by its amazing flora and fauna, its traditional dishes which are very delicious and above all because there one can appreciate the wonders of nature and escape from the bustle of the city.

Ercilio is very happy and above all hard working but when he has free  time he likes to enjoy spending it with his family since he is married and he and his wife have three wonderful children who are 11, 15 and 22 years old and whom he loves very much, are his reason to live and his motive to continue working hard each day to be able to give them the best and make then into good people. Like any good Peruvian he likes our national cuisine very much.  His favorite dish is the delicious “Tallarín con pollo” (A chicken noodle dish). He only completed his secondary education since his family did not have many financial resources. However he would have liked to study car mechanics. 

With a lot of hard work, Ercilio works in his boat transport business. He has worked in this business for many months now since he saw that the settlers would need transport, and the only way is by the river. He works in his business around 10 hours a day and can service up to 45 customers a day. He believes that his business is going well because he is very friendly with the customers and above all is very careful when transporting passengers. 
Ercilio is very grateful and happy with the help that the Kiva lenders have given him as thanks to their help he will be able to buy a new boat since the boat he has now is a bit old and above all because he wants to provide his customers with a better service and more security. In this way he will be able to transport his customers in a very safe manner and will be able to improve his income and continue fighting to make his greatest dream come true “to be able to provide his children with a profession and for them to be very proud of him.”

loans.use: to buy a boat

loans.name: Katlyn

texts.en:
This is Katlyn. She previously accessed a Php10,000 loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her child and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for a Php15,000 loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result for better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to cover her daily needs and educational expenses of her child. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 


Katlyn hopes to be able to expand soon. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tools and pay for gasoline

loans.name: Basilisa

texts.en:
Basilisa is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling rice in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell. She has been in this business for 12 years. Basilisa earns more income from farming sugarcane and retailing rice grains.

Basilisa has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a tailoring business in the Philippines.  She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy fabrics and equipment for her sewing machine.  She has been in this business for five years. Marilyn earns more income from selling jewelry.

Marilyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and equipment for her sewing machine.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria is married with three children. She is 48 years old and lives in Yahong, Tudela, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Gloria owns and operates a plot of farmland, planting bananas to earn a living. She has been in this business for 11 years and earns PHP 3,000 each month. She requested a loan of PHP 3,100 to pay for banana planting. Gloria became a member of Kiva's partner, GDMPC, in 2011. In the future, Gloria's plan is to save her returns in order to buy a house.

loans.use: to pay for banana planting

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials for repairing shoes such as adhesive, leather, soles, insoles, etc.

loans.name: Imelda Del Carmen

texts.es:
Imelda, se dedica a la venta de pupusas, tiene 39 años de edad, vive con sus tres hijos, de 12, 15 y 18 años de edad, todos estudian, su esposo le ayuda económicamente con las obligaciones del hogar; Ella tiene 5 años en el negocio, trabaja de lunes a domingo, lo aprendió de sus padres, realizándolo como una fuente de ingreso familiar.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales como leña, maíz, aceite, harina de arroz, entre otros productos que sean necesarios para continuar en la producción de las pupusas, esta compra le ayudara a mejorar la capacidad del negocio, a través del préstamo estará generando una condición más estable.
Su aspiración es fortalecer el negocio, ofrecer mejor calidad a sus clientes y que sus hijos puedan contar con una calidad de vida mejor.
texts.en:
Imelda's business is selling pupusas.  She is 39 years old and lives with her three children, aged 12, 15 and 18, who are all in school.  Her husband helps out with the household expenses.

Imelda has been in her business for five years.  She works from Monday to Sunday.  She learned the business from her parents and it is a source of family income.  

Imelda is requesting a loan to buy materials such as firewood, corn, oil, rice flour and other products that she needs in order to continue making her pupusas.  This purchase will help her to improve the capacity of her business and stabilize her situation.

Imelda's aspirations are to strengthen her business, to offer better quality to her customers, and for her children to enjoy a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy materials such as firewood, corn, oil and rice flour

loans.name: Angela Juana

texts.es: Angela Juana de 35 años de edad , casado, del domicilio de leon, tiene por actividad economica la venta de pulperia ubicada en su casa de habitacion experiencia con la cuenta de hace varios años, Angela ya ha tenido credito con leon 2000 y ha demostrado responsblidad, honrades, solvencia moral,  los financiamiento le han sido de mucha ayuda para el cremiento economico de su negocio ya que ha podido invertir en capital de trabajo, el prestamo lo esta solicitando para la compra de productos del consumo diario como: aceite, arroz, frijoles, azucar, huevo, leche, pan, tortas dulces, condimentos, hielo, leña entre otros.
texts.en:
Angela Juana is 35 years old, married and lives in Leon.  Her business is a grocery store which is located in her home.  She has several years experience.  

Angela has already received previous loans from Fundación Leon 2000 and has shown herself to be responsible, honest and of good character.  The loans have been very helpful to her in growing her business as she has been able to invest in working capital.  She has requested this loan to buy basic household products such as oil, rice, beans, sugar, eggs, milk, bread, cakes, seasonings, ice, firewood, etc.

loans.use: to buy oil, rice, beans, sugar, eggs, milk, bread, cakes, seasonings, ice, firewood, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy various lotions for resale.

loans.name: John John

texts.en: John John is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 3 children. John John has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. Aside from that he also sells charcoal. He has had this business for 6  years. He requested a loan for 8,000 PHP to increase his stock of canned goods, snacks and beverages. John John has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, he hopes to improve his business for the education of his children.

loans.use: to increase his stock of canned goods, snacks, detergents and beverages

loans.name: Evelia Del Socorro

texts.es: Evelia del Socorro de 48 años de edad , soltera con un hijo menor de edad, tiene por actividad economica venta de mercaderia en general desde hace vario años que tiene dicha actividad , la cual inico por la necesidad de tener un medio de generar ingresos para la mantencion de su hijo, en la actualidad esta solicitando el prestamo para invertir en mercaderia como: ropa de hombre camisas , pantalones, boxer, calcetines, pañuelos, tuallas, blusas, faldas, medias, juegos de sabanas entre otros.
texts.en: Evelia del Socorro is 48 years old, single and has one dependent child.  Her business is selling general merchandise and she has been in this line of work for some years.  She started her business as she needed to make income in order to support her son.  She is currently requesting this loan to invest in merchandise such as shirts, pants, boxer shorts, socks, scarves, towels, blouses, skirts, pantyhose, sheet sets, etc.

loans.use: to buy shirts, pants, boxer shorts, socks, scarves, towels, blouses, skirts, pantyhose, sheet sets, etc.

loans.name: Ma. Teresa

texts.en:
Ma. Teresa is married with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Ma. Teresa is 22 years old and has two children who are in school.

Ma. Teresa has a fishing business in the Philippines. Ma. Teresa requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing nets, paint and other equipment to repair her fishing boat.

Ma. Teresa has been in this business for three years. In the future, Ma. Teresa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, paint and other equipment to repair her fishing boat.

loans.name: Maria Marleny

texts.es:
María, vive con sus dos hijos y su esposo, ambos trabajan, ella se dedica a la venta de pupusas los fines de semana junto a su madre, este negocio lo realiza sábados y domingos, tiene ocho años de experiencia. 
Ella solicita un préstamo para invertirlo en los materiales que son necesarios para la producción de las pupusas como chicharrón, aceite, quesillo, maíz, condimentos, entre otros que le ayudaran a mejorar la capacidad del negocio, con este préstamo lograra mejorar el servicio a los clientes.
La aspiración de María es poder crecer en el negocio a través del uso de los préstamos, ser buen cliente para poder lograr su desarrollo comercial con este servicio de financiamiento.
texts.en:
María lives with her husband and two children.  Both she and her husband work. María's business is selling pupusas on a weekend together with her mother.  She works Saturdays and Sundays and has eight years experience.  She is requesting a loan to invest in the materials she needs for making her pupusas such as 'chicharrón' (cooked pork), oil, 'quesillo' (soft cheese), corn, seasonings and other products which will help her to improve the capacity of her business.  This loan will enable her to provide her customers with a better service.

María's goals are to grow in her business by using loans and to be a good client so that she can develop her business through this loan service.

loans.use: to buy cooked pork, oil, soft cheese, corn and seasonings

loans.name: Mbéry

texts.fr:
Madame Mbery  s’active dans la vente de poisson séché. Elle a une expérience de 32 ans car elle a commencé très jeune son commerce. Elle est mariée et mère de famille. Elle n’a jamais bénéficié de crédit c’est sa première fois et elle vient  solliciter un montant  de 200000Fcfa pour acheter et stocker du poisson séché .Car en période  d’hivernage ses condiments ont tendance à être en rupture. Mbery prend en charge ses propres besoin et cela, elle le fait grâce aux bénéfices générés par son activité.
Elle a comme projet futur : d’acquérir un véhicule de transport de marchandises comme cela elle pourra diminuer ses charges d’exploitation, générer  des emplois et maximiser  son profit.
texts.en:
Mrs. Mbery sells dried fish. She has 32 years of experience in this activity having started at a very young age. She is married with children. 

Mbery is seeking a loan for the first time, requesting 200,000CFAF to buy and store dried fish in anticipation for the potential stock shortages of the rainy season. She supports herself with the revenue earned from this activity.

Her goal is to get a transportation vehicle, which would help to reduce her operation costs, create jobs and maximize her profits.

loans.use: to buy dried fish for resale.

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
Jesusa is 39 years old and married with 2 children.

Jesusa is in the agricultural business raising ducks in the Philippines. Jesusa requested a PHP 23000 loan through NWTF to buy feed for her ducks.

Jesusa has been raising ducks for 6 years now, and has borrowed 12 times in the past from NWTF and more recently, from Kiva to sustain it.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy feed for her ducks.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is from Poblacion 1, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 47 years old, is married, and has four children. Violeta owns and operates a specialized retail store, primarily selling school supplies and food to the local community. She has been engaged in her business for five years and earns 15,000 PHP a month. 

Violeta is requesting a loan of 40,500 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering.

loans.name: Divina

texts.en: Divina is 58 years old and has six children. She is married to a carpenter. Divina earns a living selling local delicacies such as rice cakes and banana cues. She has a monthly income of 4,500 PHP. Divina works hard to increase her sales. She has requested a loan to purchase flour, sugar and other ingredients. This loan will help increase Divina's sales and profitability.

loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar and other ingredients.

loans.name: Abel

texts.en:
Abel is 53 years old from Olkalou. He is married to Elizabeth and they have six children who are all in school.

Abel has a butchery and hotel business that he has been running for the past six years. He has applied for his third loan from KADET Ltd. to enable him to buy food ingredients for his hotel like baking flour, eggs, sugar etc to add to his stock.

He hopes to improve his living standards and be able to educate his children.

loans.use: To buy cooking ingredients.

loans.name: Antoinette

texts.en:
Antoinette is 37 years old. She is married with three children and she takes care of four relatives. She sells food and drinks like: buns, cakes, biscuits, fanta, milk etc. She has two years of experience in this work and the hours of her business are from 6 a.m to 9 p.m daily every week. 

Antoinette has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to buy a large quantities of food and drinks like: buns, cakes, biscuits, fanta, milk etc for resale. With any profits, she will be able to save money for her future, and to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy a large quantities of food and drinks like buns, cakes, biscuits, fanta and milk to sell.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 19500 through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment for her fishing business.

Jean has been in this business for 21 years. She earns more income from frozen foods.

Jean has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Fatima works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from motorcycle transportation. Fatima is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy fishing nets and a new engine for her fishing boat.

Fatima has been sustaining her business activities through her past fifteen loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to continue sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and a new engine for her fishing boat.

loans.name: Claudine

texts.en:
Claudine is 43 years old. She is married with three children aged between 11 and 18 and all of them go to school. She has been selling various products in her boutique. 

With the loan, she wants to buy more cooking oil, rice, and matchboxes. The profits from the business will be used for paying school fees for the children.

loans.use: To buy more cooking oil, rice and matchboxes.

loans.name: Sheyla Alexandra

texts.es:
Sheyla es una joven muy trabajadora y entusiasta con muchos ánimos de salir adelante y sobre todo ser un orgullo para su madre con la cual vive en la ciudad de Pisco, ciudad que se caracteriza por su clima cálido, sus playas hermosas su agricultura en especial el cultivo algodón, maíz, y también por la pesca, podemos encontrar  también uno de los atractivos turísticos más visitados de la ciudad como lo es las Islas Ballestas y el Candelabro  de Paracas. Sheyla es muy alegre cuando dispone de un tiempito libre le gusta mucho hacer deporte en especial jugar vóley con sus amigos y vecinos de su barrio, asimismo le encanta comer junto a  su madre uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Ají de Gallina”. 

Con mucho entusiasmo y sobre todo mucho esfuerzo Sheyla trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños, ella le dedica a su trabajo alrededor de 10 horas al día y puede atender hasta 25 clientes en el día, con su trabajo apoya mucho a su madre a quien ama y quiere muchísimo y el motivo por el cual ella lucha cada día para que su madre se sienta muy orgullosa de ella, ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy trabajadora y sobre todo porque es muy amable con los clientes y por ello siempre compran sus productos.

Sheyla está muy agradecida y feliz con los  prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mostradores para poder exhibir sus productos de mejor manera y los clientes puedan apreciarlo mejor, asimismo comprara mercadería para su negocio como blusas, pantalones, poleras, entre otros para poder tener mayor variedad de productos y poder mejorar sus ingresos y poder seguir luchando para salir adelante y seguir luchando para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:  “ Poder terminar la carrera de Administración de empresas y ser el orgullo de su madre”.
texts.en: Sheyla is a very hard-working, keen young woman who has a great desire to do well in life and, above all, be a source of pride for her mother with whom she lives in the city of Pisco. Pisco is noted for its hot climate, its beautiful beaches and its agriculture. In particular, it is known for its cotton growing, corn growing and fishing. It is home to one of the most visited tourist spots in the area, the Ballestas Islands and the Candelabra of the Andes. Sheyla is very happy whenever she has any free time. She really enjoys taking part in sports. In particular, she enjoys playing volleyball with her friends and neighbors. She and her mother also enjoy eating one of their favorite dishes, the delicious 'Ají de Gallina”. With a lot of enthusiasm and effort, Sheyla works in her small business selling men's, women's and children's clothing. She works around 10 hours a day and can serve up to 25 customers each day. Through her work she supports her mother a lot. She loves her mother dearly and her motivation for working hard every day is for her mother to feel very proud of her. She believes that her business is doing well because she is very hard working and, above all, because she is very friendly to her customers. For this reason, they always buy her products. Sheyla is very grateful to Kiva lenders and very happy because, thanks to their help, she will be able to buy display cases so that she can better display her products and so that her customers can see them better. She will also buy merchandise for her business such as blouses, pants and tops. This will enable her to have a wider range of products available and she will be able to improve her income, continue working hard in order to do well in life and continue working to fulfill her biggest dream: to finish a degree in business administration and for her mother to be proud of her.

loans.use: to buy blouses, tops, pants, etc.

loans.name: Mamadou

texts.fr:
Notre emprunteur s’appelle Mamadou ; il est marié et père de famille. Mamadou s’active dans la vente de produits alimentaires  divers  depuis 5 ans maintenant il gère une boutique. Mamadou est très assidu voir qu’il démarre sa journée à 6h du matin pour la terminer à 00h.
Il a besoin  de 250000F CFA  pour acheter des denrées alimentaires telles : de l’huile, du riz, du lait, du sucre etc. Avec ce crédit, il va augmenter son stock.
Il a comme projet futur de construire sa maison et d’y loger sa famille.
texts.en:
This borrower’s name is Mamadou. He is married with children. 

Mamadou has been selling foodstuffs for five years, and he currently runs a boutique (general store). He is very devoted, starting his day at 6:00 AM to finish at midnight. 

Mamadou is seeking a loan of 250,000CFAF to buy foosdstuffs such as oil, rice, milk, sugar, etc. He will use this loan to replenish his stock. 

His goal is to build a house for his family.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs for resale in his store.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is married and has three children. She is 42 and lives in Digu-an, Ozamis City, Philippines. Nelly has a retail store that sells a variety of products, and has been in business for eight years. Each month, she earns 3,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) doing this type of business. 

She requested a loan of 3,200 PHP to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee. In 2011, Nelly joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Nelly wants to build a house and to have her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is a 33-year old resident of Tabid, Ozamis City. She provides for her four children's needs from the little amount of PHP 3,000 she gains monthly from her own banana and coconut business. She has been running this for eight years as an aid to the income gained from her husband. 

She joined GDMPC in 2011. Now she's applied for a micro loan of PHP 4,000 from GDMPC to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Jennifer wants to make expansion to her business one day.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a 19-year-old single man, who has worked in agriculture for four years. Hassan was only fifteen years old when he started working. Today he owns a tractor which he uses to plow his land and others, in addition to irrigating most of the land in his village. Hassan also distributes water to the houses of people who live in his village, because most of the time they lack water. 

Hassan applied for a youth loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, in order to do the necessary the maintenence on his tractor. This is Hassan's second cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower. His previous loan helped a lot in improving his business and social situation, and he also started building his future house with the additional income he got.

Today his loan will be invested in doing the necessary maintenance to his tractor, and he will surely continue building his house as much as he can.
Hassan hopes to keep on expanding both businesses as much as he can in the future.

loans.use: To do the necessary maintenence on his tractor.

loans.name: Lazarus

texts.en:
Lazarus is 36 years old. He supports five people of his family. He is married to Lucy who is a business lady, and who contributes to the income of the family.

He has been in business for four years and has a monthly income of sixteen thousand two hundred Kenyan shillings. The loan will be used to buy foodstuff for the hotel such as rice and cooking fat. The anticipated profits will be used to purchase additional stock.

This is his fifth loan with KADET Ltd. and he has paid them back successfully. His hopes and dreams are to open an wholesale shop.

loans.use: to buy foodstuff for the hotel and purchase additional stock for the shop.

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling dried fish in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 19,500 through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her dried fish business.

Elvie has been in this business for seven years.

Elvie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a ready-to-wear clothing sales business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 10,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell. 

Carmelita has been in this business for four years. She earns more income from food vending. 

Carmelita has been sustaining her business through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 41 years old and married with six children.

Emma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell.

Emma has borrowed and paid for eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Emma aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food business in the Philippines.

Gina requested a PHP 27,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business.

She has been in this business for eight years now, and also earns additional income from selling herbal medicines and jewellery.

In the future, Gina would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Maria Fe

texts.en:
Maria Fe is from Dela Paz, Clarin. She is 50 years old. Maria Fe is widowed and has three children. To make a living, Maria Fe has owned and operated a transportation service for seven years. She earns 10,000 PHP a month for these activities. 

In 2005, Maria Fe joined GDMPC. Maria Fe is requesting a loan of 19,800 PHP, which will be used to repair an existing vehicle so it gives better service. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to repair an existing vehicle so it gives better service.

loans.name: La Benediction Group

texts.fr: Le groupement BÉNÉDICTION est composé de 13 personnes qui sont spécialisés dans de différents domaines. Certains exercent comme activité la vente des assiettes, des cuvettes, du sucre et d'autres du maïs, des beignets, de la boisson locale, des produits de premières nécessités, de l’igname. La responsable est une dame âgée de 55ans qui est spécialisée dans la vente des assiettes et cuvettes. Elle est mariée à un enseignant et a 01 enfant âgé de 30ans qui ne fréquente plus.  Elle a démarré son activité en 2005 et s’approvisionne généralement à Lomé chez les grossistes et revend dans un quartier au centre du pays. Elle est à son second crédit de WAGES et sollicite ce prêt pour acheter plus de marchandises afin de satisfaire les besoins des clients. Elle veut construire une boutique pour installer ses marchandises, réaliser un bon chiffre d’affaire et aider ses petits frères dans le domaine scolaire.
texts.en:
The group BÉNÉDICTION consists of 13 people who specialize in various sectors. Some sell plates, bowls, or sugar while others sell maize, beignets, local beverages, staples, or yams. 

The head of the group is a 55-year-old lady who sells plates and bowls. She is married to a teacher and the couple have one child, age 30, who no longer attends school. She started her activity in 2005, and she usually gets her merchandise from wholesalers in Lomé for resale in a district at the center of the country. 

This is her second loan from WAGES, and she is seeking this credit to stock up on merchandise to meet customer demand. 

She wants to build a boutique to display her merchandise, bolster her sales, and help to support her younger brothers’ education.

loans.use: to buy plates and bowls for resale.

loans.name: Esther Wanjiku

texts.en:
Esther used her previous loan to buy heifer cows for rearing and selling. It turned out to be profitable and she was able to pay all the loan amount.

This will be her ninth loan and she plans to use the amount to buy a heifer cow as well as fertilizer and seeds for planting on her farm. With the anticipated profits she plans to pay school fees for her children.

In the future, Esther hopes to become one of the top horticulture farmers in Ndunyu Njeru town.

loans.use: To buy a heifer, seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, soap, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Augustin

texts.en:
Augustin is 30 years old and is married with two children between the age of two and five, and he also takes care of three relatives. He owns a motorcycle business. Agustin has four years of experience in this work. The hours of his business are from 5 a.m to 10 p.m every day each week.
