texts.en: Hilda Cefernia is single and has three adult children; she’s from León.  Her economic activity for the last 23 years has been selling fruit and vegetables in her local market.  She started the business needing to earn income for her children.  She is currently asking for financing to invest in her business buying such items as: papayas, pineapples, passion fruit, tomatoes, onions, peppers, chilies, baby corn, pumpkin and potatoes, among others.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Primicia Group

texts.es:
El comité "Primicia" lleva mas de 3 años de organización y trabajo con la Fundación Paraguaya. Todas ellas son mujeres emprendedoras y con ganas de salir adelante por medio de su propio esfuerzo.
La Sra. Mirtha es una de las integrantes de este comité, se unió al comité por la necesidad de salir adelante y una ayuda que le permita generar mas ingresos para solventar los diversos gastos del hogar. Ella es vendedora de ropas y cosmeticos en forma ambulante. Anhela un futuro mejor para su hijo es por eso que se esfuerza todos los días para darles la oportunidad de estudiar y lograr un futuro mejor.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas de todo tipo, con lo cual podrá tener una buena variedad de prendas que pueda ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The Primicia communal bank has been organized and working with the Fundación Paraguaya for three years.  All of the women are enterprising, and they have the desire to get ahead through their own efforts.

Mirtha is a member of the communal bank.  She joined the bank out of the need to get ahead.  She also joined for help that would allow her to generate more income to pay the diverse household expenses.

She sells clothes and cosmetics in an itinerant manner.  She yearns for a better future for her offspring.  That is why she works hard every day.  She does so in order to provide the opportunity for an education and to achieve a better future.

She is requesting the loan to by all types of clothes.  This way she will be able to have a good variety of clothes that she can offer her customers.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Ricardo Alberto

texts.es: Ricardo tiene 44 años de edad, es casado, tiene 3 hijos, vive con su familia en el municipio de Omoa, Cortes. hace dos años que Ricardo inicio con el negocio de servicios secretariales, donde ofrece impresiones a color de todo tipo, encuadernaciones, fotocopias de documentos y venta de lápices y bolígrafos. Anteriormente Ricardo se dedicaba a la venta de libros y a realizar trabajos de encuadernación. Siempre le ha gustado esta actividad y por eso es muy conocido en la comunidad. Esta solicitando un préstamo por 10,000.00 Lempiras para surtir de materiales y útiles de oficina como ser: material para encuadernar libros, resmas de papel, tintas de impresoras, para las fotocopias y los trabajos de impresión y bolígrafos y lápices para la venta. Esta inversión le ayudara a incrementar las ventas y a crecer en clientes. Su meta es tener un negocio más grande y muy rentable de donde pueda obtener los ingresos necesarios para que su familia viva mejor.
texts.en:
Ricardo is 44 years old, married, and has three children. He lives with his family in the town of Omoa, Cortes.

Two years ago, Ricardo started his own business of providing secretarial services. He offers color printing, document binding, photocopying, and the sale of pencils and pens. Ricardo previously sold books in addition to providing binding services. He has always enjoyed this activity and has become well-known in the community.

Ricardo is requesting a loan of 10,000 HNL so that he can restock with materials and supplies for his office such as bookbinding materials, reams of paper, photocopier and printer ink, and pens and pencils to sell. This investment will increase his sales and help to attract more customers. His goal is to have a larger and more profitable business where he can generate more income that he needs to provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to buy bookbinding materials, reams of paper, photocopier and printer ink, and pens and pencils to sell.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad is a 24-year-old single man who has worked as a carpenter for 10 years. Mohamad was too young when he started working to help his family earn a living. In August 2011, Mohamad started his own business from home. He makes furniture, in addition to plexiglass designs and requests. Mohamad is a hard worker. He puts a lot of effort into spreading his name all over the region. Mohamad is applying for a YOUTH LOAN from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to open a workshop to expand his production. He has been an Al Majmoua borrower for four cycles. All his previous loans helped a lot in improving his business. During that time he was a borrower in good standing. Mohamad is planning to keep on expanding his business by opening a bigger work space and employing new staff to help reply to customers' requests.

loans.use: to open a workshop

loans.name: Elizaban

texts.en:
Elizaban, age 32, operates a retail shop where he sells kerosene. He has been in the business for seven years and has three employees. He describes his immediate environment as competitive. 

He is the recipient of a previous loan from Faulu Kenya, which helped him grow his business. He has also learned how to better manage his business because he has received training in business management. 

He is now requesting a loan in the amount of 100,000 KES in order to buy kerosene to offer for resale.

Elizaban dreams of expanding his business and becoming more successful in future.

loans.use: to buy kerosene to offer for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy beaded sandals and beauty accessories to offer for sale

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es:
El señor Santiago tiene 63 años, está casado con la Señora Myrian de 57 años, tienen  3 hijos, mayores que trabajan en el extranjero. El señor Santiago se dedica a la venta de ropas, calzados, bijouterie, etc. Empezó realizando la venta llegando a entidades públicas y casas particulares, con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación fue logrando salir adelante y gracias a la ayuda de su esposa ahora ya cuentan con un local en su casa y desde allí realiza su venta.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de pantalones, camisas, blusas, bijouterie con lo cual podrá surtirse y de esa forma poder seguir ofreciendo una buena variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Santiago is 63-years-old, married to Myrian, 57; they have three adult children who work abroad.  Santiago sells clothes, shoes, costume jewelry, etc.  

He started selling at public institutions and private homes.  With much effort and dedication he managed to get ahead and thanks to his wife’s help they now have a locale at home where he conducts his sales.

He’s asking for the loan to buy pants, shirts, blouses, costume jewelry to stock up and be able to continue offering a good variety to his customers.

loans.use: to buy clothes, costume jewelry, etc.

loans.name: Virgen De Fatima Group

texts.es:
El comité se denomina “Virgen de Fatima”, está integrado  por  14  señoras muy activas y solidarias  que se unieron con el propósito de salir adelante y ayudar a sus familias por medio de ese trabajo.
Noelia es parte del grupo, ella es la presidenta del grupo, y comenta que siempre trata de animar e incentivar a sus amigas para que trabajen juntas y salgan adelante. Ella se dedica a la venta de prendas, en lo que le está yendo muy bien, pues ella tiene muy buena onda con las ventas. Solicita el préstamo para la compra de prendas como ser pantalones, jeans, camisas y demás tipos, con los cuales quiere surtirse y cumplir con el pedido de sus clientes.
texts.en:
The committee is called “Virgen de Fátima” and it’s composed of 14 very active, mutually supportive women who joined together in order to get ahead and help their families by means of this work.

Noelia is part of the group; she’s the group president and comments that she always tries to encourage and motivate her friends so that they will work together and get ahead.  She sells clothes and is doing very well in it because she’s very good at sales.  She’s asking for the loan to buy articles of clothing like pants, jeans, shirts and other types to stock up and fill her customers’ orders.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 40 years old and lives in the town of Kyengera in the Kampala west region of Uganda. She is married and has four children who are all currently in school. For the past six years, Ruth has been working hard to manage her small business, which sells spare parts. 

To help expand her business, Ruth has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more spare parts for resale, and will help Ruth to generate greater profits and open up more shops. Ruth hopes that in the future she will be able to start buying her goods from outside countries. 

Ruth is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Ruth who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more spare parts for resale.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth, age 38, sells groceries to earn a living. She has operated her business for 12 years and earns a monthly income of PHP 20,000. She lives with her husband and four children in Baybay, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental.

Elizabeth has been a member of PMPC for three years. She has requested a loan in the amount of PhP 10,000 in order to buy grocery goods to offer for sale in her store. She hopes to improve her family's living conditions through the profits expected from the loan and through the continued success of her store.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods to offer for sale in her store

loans.name: Hudson

texts.en:
Hudson, a 30-year-old married father of four children who are all in school, lives in the town of Kibuli in the Kampala South region of Uganda. For the past 10 years, Hudson has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells essential goods and food products.

To help expand his business, Hudson has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to increase store stock and will help him to generate greater profits and expand the business. Hudson hopes that in the future he will be able to earn more profits.

Hudson is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Hudson who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to increase store stock.

loans.name: Risalie

texts.en:
Risalie, age 44, is a direct seller of Avon and MSE products. She has been running this business for 10 years and also earns an income from the retail sale of herbal products. She and her husband have one child. She works hard to provide for her family. 

Risalie has borrowed and repaid 14 loans from NWTF before this loan. She is requesting a new loan in the amount of PhP 29,500 through NWTF in order to purchase more Avon and MSE items to offer for sale.

She aspires to build and expand her business with the goal of securing the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more Avon and MSE items to offer for sale

loans.name: Odette

texts.en:
Odette, age 22, sells bicycle spare parts to earn a living. She has been operating this business for eight years. She and her husband have a one-year-old baby. 

The loan she has requested will be used to buy bicycle spare parts for her business. The profits from the loan will be used to renovate the family house.

loans.use: to buy bicycle spare parts for her business

loans.name: Divino Niño Group

texts.es:
Divino Niño es el grupo que se formo en la ciudad de Caacupé por 13 mujeres, todas ellas amigas y vecinas de esa ciudad, que vieron una gran oportunidad de progreso en el programa de la fundación paraguaya.
Angelina es costurera y cuenta que todos los días trabaja desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana, ya que siempre tiene mucho trabajo que hacer. Cuenta que tiene buena clientela pues sus trabajos son muy buenos.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de telas, gomas, cierres, hilos, botones y demás insumos para poder cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes.
texts.en:
“Divino Niño” (Holy Child) is the group formed in the city of Caacupé by 13 women who are all friends and neighbors from that city who saw a great opportunity for progress in Fundación Paraguaya’s program.

Angelina is a seamstress and she relates that she works every day from very early in the morning because she always has much work to do.  She relates that she has a good clientele because her work is very good.

She’s asking for the loan to buy fabric, glue, zippers, thread, buttons and other supplies to be able to fill all her customer orders.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies.

loans.name: Sara Ondina

texts.es:
Sara,  tiene 29 años de edad, es casada, tiene 3 hijos, vive en una colonia suburbana de San Pedro Sula.
Ella estableció su propio negocio en su casa donde vende ropa de segunda mano, vende vestidos, faldas, camisetas, jeans, sabanas, cortinas y ropa para niños. Este negocio lo estableció hace 5 años y ha logrado mantenerlo estable reinvirtiendo sus ganancias, lo ha establecido en el garaje de su casa, dedicándole tiempo por las tardes.  Esta solicitando 12,000.00 Lempiras para comprar otros fardos de ropa de la clasificada Premium porque viene ropa variada para damas, caballeros y niños. Ella espera aumentar su clientela ya que va ofrecer variedad de producto. Su meta es lograr pagar bien este préstamo para  solicitar otro para establecer un local fijo para su tiendita de ropa.
texts.en:
Sara, 29, is married and has three children; she lives in a suburban neighborhood in San Pedro Sula.

She started her own home-based business where she sells second-hand clothing.  She sells dresses, skirts, t-shirts, jeans, sheets, drapes and children’s clothes.  She started the business five years ago and has managed to keep it stable by reinvesting her profits in it.  She set it up in her garage and spends afternoons in it.

She’s asking for a 12,000 lempira loan to buy more bundles of Premium-rated clothing because they contain assorted clothes for women, men and children.  She hopes to increase her clientele because she’ll have more variety of products available.  

Her goal is to manage to repay this loan well in order to request another one so that she can establish a fixed locale for her little clothing store.

loans.use: to buy bundles of clothes.

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo lleva por nombre“ Mujeres trabajadoras“  ya que sus miembros son realmente mujeres trabajadoras y luchadoras, que se esfuerzan al maximo para poder salir adelante y poder romper las limitaciones economicas.
La sra. Gladys es costurera, esta acompañada hace 10 años con el señor Jorge, con quiene tiene 2 hijas .Ella solicita  el credito  para la compra de telas, agujas, hilos para la confeccion de prendas para bebe. Gladys tiene como meta ir creciendo en su negocio e ir comprando mas maquinas de coser y  brindando asi un mejor estilo de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
This group is called 'Mujeres Trabajadoras' (Hard-Working Women) because all of its members are hard-working, tenacious women who give 100% so that they can get ahead in life and cast aside their financial limitations.

Gladys is a seamstress who has been married to Jorge for ten years.  The couple have two children.  She is requesting a loan to buy fabric, needles and thread for making baby clothing.  Gladys' goals are to continue growing in her business, to buy more sewing machines and to provide her family with a better lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fabric, needles, threads, etc.

loans.name: Eva Alejandrina

texts.es:
Eva, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo por la necesidad de seguir aumentando su negocio,  su objetivo es comprarse otro coche para poder instalar un nuevo punto de venta en otra zona, esto le ayudará para mejorar sus ingresos y poder crecer en el mercado abarcando una mayor clientela.
Ella manifiesta que con el préstamo anterior logró realizar una buena inversión aumentando las ventas y sus ganancias con un nuevo punto de venta, que le han permitido darle una mejor condición de vida a su familia  aumentandole sus beneficios en alimentación y salud.
texts.en:
Eva is requesting a new loan because she needs to continue growing her business.  Her goal is to buy another car so that she can set up a new sales location in another area.  This will help her to improve her income and she will be able to grow in the market, reaching more customers.

Eva says that she was able to make a good investment with her previous loan.  She increased her sales and her profits with a new sales location.  This allowed her to provide her family with better living conditions and she has increased her benefits in terms of food and health.

loans.use: to buy a new car

loans.name: Gary Lorenzo

texts.en:
This is Gary, a 33-year-old resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. He is married to Jean, a computer encoder and mother to their child. Gary, together with his wife, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Gary maintains a tricycle business. He owns and drives a tricycle (motorcycle with sidecar) that carries up to four passengers to their destination within the community. He works from early in the morning until late in the evening, earning a minimum of Php 400 everyday. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community.

To help him continue operations of his business, Gary is requesting a loan of Php 11,000 to buy motorcycle parts for the maintenance of his tricycle unit. He has to maintain it in good condition in order to have a regular income for the daily needs of his family.

Gary hopes to support his child's schooling up to college level. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners gathering each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the spare parts and maintenance of his tricycle unit.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda earns a living by operating a motorcycle transportation business. She has been engaged in this business for one year now. She is married and works hard to support her family. 

She is requesting a loan in the amount of PhP 20,000 through NWTF in order to buy spare parts for her business.
 
In the future, Rosalinda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her motorcycle transportation business

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a 62-year-old businessman. He is married to Janet who is a mixed crop farmer. They are blessed with five children. He has been running a photocopying shop as a primary business and a phone accessories outlet as a second business for the past four years with the monthly income of KES 11,000 which he uses to support his family. 

He is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD, after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Daniel will use the loan to buy printing paper and plain paper. He will also buy new phones for selling. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to venture into poultry rearing and improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: to buy printing paper and plain paper.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose earns a living by operating a general store. She was the recipient of a previous loan in the amount of PhP 23,000, which she used to purchase larger quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. The increase in her earnings was a big help toward paying for the educational fees of her children and to cover the costs of the family's personal, household, and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for a Php28,000 loan so that she can buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her inventory. She feels that the more items are displayed at the store, the better. Offering more items for sale will result in a higher profit, and her increased earnings will significantly help her to meet the family's daily needs and provide for the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Rose is confident that she will grow her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her inventory

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is 36 years old. He is married to Margaret and together they have two children aged 14 and 10 years old. He operates a quarry and has been in the business for the past eight years. He gets a monthly income of KES 23,000 from the business.

This is his second loan from KADET LTD. He repaid his previous loan timely. He was introduced to us by one of our field officers. He will use the loan amount to start poultry farming. He will purchase chicks and chick feeds to start a poultry farming business.

He hopes to become financially stable and provide for the school fees of his children.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and chick feeds to start a poultry farming business

loans.name: Daphrose

texts.en:
Daphrose, age 43, sells spare bicycle parts. She has been in this business since the beginning of this year. Before she began her spare parts business, she was engaged in selling handbags. 

With this loan, she plans to buy lamps and more spare bicycle parts. With the profits, she intends to add to her savings.

loans.use: to buy lamps as well as to obtain more bicycle spare parts to offer for sale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her store.

loans.name: Maria Leonor

texts.es:
María, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para poder invertir en su negocio, que es la prestación de servicios con un molino de nixtamal, ya que necesita mantenimiento y reparación para lo cual deberá comprarse repuestos y pagar mano de obra para que pueda funcionar adecuadamente el molino, este préstamo le dará los recursos necesarios para que ella pueda realizar su trabajo sin perder la preferencia del cliente.
Ella manifiesta que el préstamo anterior le ha aumentado el buen servicio con los clientes, ya que le ha atendido con una mejor calidad en su negocio con variedad de productos, esto también le ha beneficiado a ella y a su familia con ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
María is asking for a new loan to invest in her business which is providing corn milling services because it needs service and repair; she must buy replacement parts and pay labor costs so that the mill will run properly.  This loan will give her the necessary resources so that she can continue doing her work and not lose customers.

She states that the previous loan increased customer service because she had better quality and variety of products; it has also benefitted her and her family with income.

loans.use: to pay labor costs to repair her mill.

loans.name: Zaira

texts.ru:
Заира замужем, имеет одну взрослую дочь. Заира торгует на Центральном рынке детской и женской одеждой. Она продает платья, сарафаны и блузы. Торговое место Заиры собственное, опыт работы 17 лет. 

В прошлом году Заира столкнулась с трудностью - резкий спад торговли, а также изменение курса доллара, что привело к удорожанию закупаемого товара. Благодаря своей настойчивости и трудолюбию Заира смогла преодолеть тяжелое для нее время и вывести свой бизнес на прежний уровень.

Несмотря на свой возраст (58 лет) Заира намерена развивать свой бизнес дальше и увеличивать торговый оборот. Она просит предоставить ей кредит в размере 15,000 гривен на закупку сезонного товара. Дополнительную прибыль Заира планирует пустить на развитие бизнеса.
texts.en:
Irina is married and has an adult daughter. Irina works at the Central market and sells women's and children's clothing - dresses, tunics, and blouses. She owns her retail location and has 17 years of experience in this trade.

Last year, Irina encountered some difficulties - a sharp decline in the volume of sales, together with a fluctuating currency exchange rate that increased the cost of her merchandise. Thanks to her persistence and hard work, Irina was able to persevere through the hard time and restore her business' profitability to previous levels.

Despite her age (58), Irina plans to continue developing her business and increasing her sales volume. She is requesting a loan of 15,000 hryvnia to purchase seasonal merchandise. Irina plans to use her additional profits for expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal merchandise

loans.name: Tsendsuren

texts.en:
Tsendsuren, 59, has worked as an accountant for many years. She is widowed and lives with her daughter in Darkhan, the second largest city in Mongolia. She owns an apartment with 2 rooms. It is one of the old apartments which were built during the socialist era and most of them have never had any complete repair in the past years. So do, her apartment never had any big repair or renovation for many years.  This causes heat loss and emissions through the walls and windows. In the winter, she and her daughter feel very cold and always have cold or flu due to the cold rooms.  She  usually uses a furnace that uses coal to stay warm.  Tsendsuren wants to make a big repair to her house. This will include wall insulation. 

Although Mongolia has the lowest population density in the world, it is one of the most polluted countries in the world.  This is due to the long and cold winters where temperatures frequently go below -40C (-40F) even in the cities.  Also, in summer, many parts of the country are extremely cold and are known to have snow storms.  Both homes and nomadic tents burn a lot of fuel and emit huge amounts of pollution every night from families just trying to stay warm.  As well, the extremely toxic smoke from the cars is one of main reason for Mongolia's air pollution. In response to this, Credit Mongol offers Green Loans to their clients to make home improvements that reduce heat loss, improve heating systems and buy cars which run on natural gas.  We believe that together we can decrease pollution and the harmful effects it has on the environment and Mongolians' health. The loan Tsendsuren is taking will be used to cover the cost of the insulation materials and installation for her apartment repair.

loans.use: install insulation for her apartment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tools and pay for gasoline

loans.name: Dior

texts.fr: Dior est une femme mariée.Elle est mère de six enfants dont les quatre fréquentent l'école.Elle passe toute la journée à la maison pour s'occuper des taches ménagères ( préparer les repas, s'occuper des enfants...). Elle utilise aussi le grand espace de la maison pour faire de  l'élevage de moutons à domicile.Elle achète des moutons, les engraisse et les revend au bout de quelques mois.Cette activité lui permet de subvenir à la plupart de ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants.Elle sollicite aujourd'hui un pret de 300000f pour acheter 8 moutons, des aliments et des produits de santé animale.
texts.en:
Dior is a married mother of six children, four of whom attend school. She spends her days at home tending to household duties (preparing meals, taking care of the children, etc.). 

She uses the house’s largest area to raise sheep in her home. She buys sheep, fattems them, and then sells them after a few months. This helps her to support herself and her children. 

She is seeking a loan of 300,000F to buy 8 sheep as well as some feed and animal health products.

loans.use: to buy 8 sheep as well as some feed and animal health products.

loans.name: Abdul Akim

texts.en:
Abdul Akim is 26 years old and lives in the town of Kyengera in the Kampala West region of Uganda. For the past 5 years, Abdul Akim has been working hard to manage his small business, which sells glass. 

To help expand his business, Abdul Akim has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more building glass for resale, and will help Abdul Akim generate greater profits and increase his business. Abdul Akim hopes that in the future he will be able to build a house of his own. 

Abdul Akim is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Abdul Akim who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy building glass to sell

loans.name: Zolbayar

texts.en:
Zolbayar, 22, works as a janitor in a hotel in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been working for 9 months. His salary is not so good and it does not meet with his monthly necessities often. He lives with his wife, a student, and his daughter in his old house which is in the ger district, an area of city with no running water, minimal roads and spotty electricity. Currently, his job is the main income source for his family. 

Zolbayar's house has too much heat loss and emissions in winter. This is caused by old, bad walls and some other parts of his house and it costs much in coal fuel to warm his home. His daughter, 2, always has flu in the winter time. So, Zolbayar planned to repair his house. To start, he is planning to add wall insulation with bricks and cement. He thinks this will keep his home warm and there will be no more emissions after the insulation. 

Although Mongolia has the lowest population density in the world, it is one of the most polluted countries in the world.  This is due to the long and cold winters where temperatures frequently go below -40C (-40F) even in the cities.  Also, in summer, many parts of the country are extremely cold and are known to have snow storms.  Both homes and nomadic tents burn a lot of fuel and emit huge amounts of pollution every night from families just trying to stay warm.  As well, the extremely toxic smoke from the cars is one of main reason for Mongolia's air pollution. In response to this, Credit Mongol offers Green Loans to their clients to make home improvements that reduce heat loss, improve heating systems and buy cars that run on natural gas.  We believe that together we can decrease pollution and the harmful effects it has on the environment and Mongolians' health. The loan Zolbayar is taking will be used to buy and install insulation for his house.

loans.use: buy and install insulation for his house

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
This is 33-year-old Aminata.  She is married and has 2 children, aged 8 years (they are twins). She has 1 additional dependent who lives with her because of schooling.  In 2010, Aminata established her building materials business. She began her business because she wants to generate income so that she can take proper care of her family. Working 7 days a week and 8 hrs a day, she earns about Le 1,300,000 every month from this business. 

Aminata would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000 in order to buy more building materials to resell. In the future, Aminata plans to build a house and import building materials into the country.   She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: buy building materials to sell

loans.name: Rolin

texts.en:
Rolin is 25 years old and lives in Mansabay Bajo, Lopez Jaena. She is married and has 1 child. 

Rolin works in the fish industry and sells/catches fish for a living. She has been doing this for 5 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase gasoline, pay for machine maintenance, and buy hooks and fishing materials.

Rolin has been a member of PMPC for 4 years. In the future, Rolin hopes to save more for her family.

loans.use: pay for gas, maintenance, and supplies for her fishing business

location.town: Plaridel-Mansabay Bajo Lopez Jaena Misamis Occiden

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is 42 years old and lives in the town of Kibuli in the Kampala South region of Uganda. He is married and has 5 children -- 4 of them are currently in school. For the past 10 years, Ali has been working hard to manage his poultry farm business, which sells eggs and layers. 

To help expand his business, Ali has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to to increase stock, and will help Ali generate greater profits and expand the business. Ali hopes that in the future he will be able to to create other businesses. 

Ali is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Ali who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy poultry

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
As a married parent of 3 children, Gloria works hard to support her family.  She has a furniture business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Gloria is borrowing PHP 19000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her furniture business.

Gloria has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: buy materials for her furniture business

loans.name: Tuvshinzorig

texts.en:
Tuvshinzorig, 33, is planning to buy a car that uses natural gas. He works as a construction field specialist in a construction company. He lives with his wife and his 3 children in a common apartment in Darkhan, the second largest city in Mongolia. 

Tuvshinzorig will use this loan to purchase a car for his family and to run a taxi business when he has leisure time to make extra earnings. This kind of car is a little bit expensive in the Mongolian market, but he and his family totally believe that using the car with a natural gas engine is one of the best contributions to the natural environment to reduce pollution. Now he needs about 5,000,000 MNT to cover some of the cost of this car purchase. Let’s encourage his and his family's effort to help their environment!

loans.use: buy a natural gas car

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
As a married parent of 8 children, Remedios works hard to support her family.  She has a fruits and spices vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending. Remedios is borrowing PHP 18000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell in her fruits and spices vending business.

Remedios has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: purchase fruits and spices sell

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
This is Merlinda, 53, resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Benjamin, a driver, and is the mother to their children. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income to cover their everyday expenses.

Merlinda operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She makes a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 18,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Merlinda hopes to be able to expand soon. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is 23 years old and lives in Alsawiya village in Ramallah. He has two jobs, one being a mobile phones shop he has operated with his brothers for three years offering mobile maintenace, computer software and mobile accessories.

Ahmad is requesting this youth loan from Ryada to buy a copier machine and more mobile phones for his shop in order to develop his business and increase his income.

loans.use: to buy a copier machine and more mobile phones.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel, 42 years old, is a married father of four children between the ages of 7 and 14 years. Emmanuel has been selling cows for 15 years, and he currently employs four people to help him. The hours of his business are from 6 a.m. to 6 p.m. Monday through Friday.

Emmanuel has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to buy more cows for resale. With the profits he will be able to save money for his future and pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy more cows for resale.

loans.name: Edson Richard

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal DINAMICO ,el socio tiene 25 años y es soltero,el socio alterna sus actividades diarias trabajando en una agencia de viajes de turismo ,el socio lleva buen tiempo en este su trabajo el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia ,el socio es etudiante de la carrera de guia de turismo le falta poco para terminar su carrera y poder salir a guiar,el socio es una persona responsable con muchas ganas de continuar trabajando.
El socio solicita el credito para pagar sus mensualidades de su instituto.
El socio se siente agradecido por el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the "DINAMICO" ["Dynamic"] communal bank. He is 25 years old and single. He spends part of his time each day working at a tourist travel agency. He has done this work for some time now, and it is going well for him thanks to the dedication he puts into it every day. He is also a student, working toward qualification as a tourist guide. He is close to finishing his program so that he can go out and work as a guide. The borrower is a responsible person with a great desire to keep working. 

He is requesting the loan to pay the monthly tuition at his institute. 

The borrower is grateful for the loan provided to him, and he is committed to making his payments on schedule.

loans.use: to pay the monthly tuition at the institute where he studies.

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.ru: Людмила в этот раз взяла кредит с целью пополнить оборотные средства. Она надеется направить кредит на дальнейшее развитие бизнеса. Прошлый год выдался трудным, в зимнее время из-за сложных погодных условий наблюдался спад торговли, вследствие чего бизнес Людмилы тоже переживал непростые времена. Тем не менее Людмила не только смогла удержаться на плаву, но даже смогла получить дополнительную прибыль, на которую она затем приобрела стройматериалы на благоустройство придомовой территории для своей семьи. За счет получения прибыли от вложения заемных средств Людмила планирует сделать ремонт в доме в ближайшем будущем.
texts.en:
Ludmila's current loan will help her to replenish her working capital. She is hoping to use this money to continue expanding her business.

Last year was difficult for Ludmila as there was a decline in sales during winter due to adverse weather, and her business went through hard times. Nevertheless, Ludmila not only stayed afloat but managed to increase her profits, which she used to purchase building materials and improve the property next to her family's home. She plans to use her profits from this loan to carry out home repairs in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase motor oil, pain, auto cosmetics, etc.

loans.name: Patricie

texts.en: Patricie is 33 years old. She is a mother of three children and all are enrolled in schools. With the loan, she wants to buy more rice, sugar, and cooking oil to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for the children.

loans.use: To buy more rice, cooking oil, and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand her summer inventory with dresses, skirts and blouses

loans.name: Juntos Podemos Confluencia Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “Juntos podemos Confluencia” está conformado por 17 emprendedores quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran; venta de leña, tejidos, costuras, venta de mermeladas, comida rápida, provisiones, servicios entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Chillan.
Katerine, presidenta del grupo del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra sentada en primera fila, ocupando en el segundo lugar de derecha a izquierda, viste blue jeans, chaqueta de color gris, su cabello lo usa suelto y es de color castaño oscuro.
Ella se dedica al rubro de bazar donde vende artículos para el hogar, y ropa, se desempeña en este negocio desde hace 3 meses. Comenta que su bazar lo ubica en un aparte de su casa, trabaja 4 días de la semana y su horario lo distribuye de acuerdo a su disponibilidad.
La mercadería e insumos que va necesitando los compra en la ciudad de Santiago en diferentes distribuidoras.
Con el crédito comprará calcetines, camisetas, pantys, de diferentes tallas, para grandes y chicos.
Las metas es seguir con su negocio e instalar un local establecido donde pueda atender a su clientela de forma más cómoda, así con esto optar a una mejor calidad de vida e ingreso familiar.
Katerine vive junto a su madre, hermana e hija pequeña de 4 años de edad. Su sueño a nivel personal es Estudiar una carrera donde pueda realizarse  profesionalmente.
Katerine está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad que le ha brindado Fondo Esperanza para invertir en su negocio. Además se siente muy cómoda con el grupo que participa, ya que son unidos, existe respeto y confianza.
Chillán es una comuna de la zona centro sur de Chile. Su nombre significa “silla del sol” en mapudungun, idioma de nuestros indígenas mapuches. Chillán es conocida como “Cuna de la Patria” o “Tierra de Artistas”, debido a que en la ciudad han nacido destacados personajes de la historia de Chile, como por ejemplo el conocido pianista Claudio Arrau.
texts.en:
This Communal Bank called “Juntos Podemos Confluencia” (We Can Join Together) consists of 17 entrepreneurs who engage in different trades such as selling firewood, weaving, sewing, selling marmalade, preparing fast food, selling provisions, providing services, and other business activities. All of the members are from the city of Chillán.

Katerine, the president of the Communal Bank, is seen in the photo seated in the first row. She is in the second position going from right to left and is wearing blue jeans, a gray jacket, and has chestnut brown hair that she is wearing down. Katerine has a bazaar where she sells household goods and clothing. She established this business three months ago. Katerine says that her business is located in a section of her house where she works four days per week. Her distribution schedule is determined by her availability. The merchandise and supplies that she needs are purchased in the city of Santiago from different distributors. With her loan, she will purchase socks, T-shirts, and undergarments of various sizes, especially extra-large garments and articles targeted at young people. Her goals are to continue her business and relocate it to an area where she can serve her customers more comfortably. This will help her achieve a better quality of life and generate more income for her family.

Katerine lives with her mother, her sister, and her four-year-old daughter. Her dream on a personal level is to study for a degree so that she can become a professional. Katerine is very pleased with and appreciative of the opportunity provided by Fondo Esperanza to invest in her business. In addition, she feels very comfortable with the group in which she participates since the members are unified and demonstrate respect and trust.

Chillán is a community in south-central Chile. Its name means “Seat of the Sun” in Mapudungun, the language of the indigenous Mapuche people. Chillán is also known as “The Cradle of the Nation” and “Land of Artists” because many leading figures in Chilean history were born here, such as the famous pianist Claudio Arrau.

loans.use: to buy socks, T-shirts, and undergarments of various sizes.

loans.name: Edouard

texts.en:
Edouard, a 37-year-old married father of six children between the ages of 3 and 17 years, also takes care of one relative. Edouard has been selling meat for 14 years and currently employs four people to help him. The hours of his business are from 6 a.m. to 6 p.m. Monday through Friday.

Edouard has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to buy a large quantity of meat to roast for sale. With the profits, he will be able to save money for his future and to renovate his house.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of meat to roast for sale.

loans.name: Jeannette

texts.en: Jeannette is 49 years old. She has been selling sweaters, dresses, and suits for a period of twenty years. The loan will be used to add more sweaters, dresses and suites. The profits from the business will be used to renovate the house.

loans.use: To buy more sweaters, dresses, and suits for sale

loans.name: Assane

texts.fr: Depuis le décès de son père, Assane a hérité des terres de sa famille.Chaque hivernage, il cultive de l'arachide , du mil et de haricots.Le mil et le haricot sont destinés à la consommation familiale alors que l'arachide est vendue.Il utilise toutefois la paille d'arachide pour nourrir les moutons et les bœufs qu'il élève en même temps.Ces activités d'agriculture et d'élevage lui permettent d'entretenir sa famille et de subvenir également à ses propres besoins.Aujourd'hui, il sollicite un pret de 300000f pour acheter un bœuf qu'il va engraisser et revendre au bout de six mois.
texts.en:
When his father passed away, Assane inherited the family’s land. Each rainy season he grows groundnuts, millet and beans. He keeps the millet and beans to feed the family, whereas the groundnuts are sold although he does use groundnut hay to feed the sheep and cattle that he raises.  

These activities allow him to support his family and provide for his own needs. 

He is seeking a loan of 300,000F to buy an ox, which he will fatten and sell after a period of six months.

loans.use: to buy an ox to be fattened and sold.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more cows for resale.

loans.name: Kholli

texts.ru: Холли проживает в районе Шахритус. Ему 56 лет. Он вдовец. Холли вместе с сыном и отцом занимается животноводством. Он разводит мелко - рогатый скот у себя дома. Кредит берет для закупа овец и коз с целью увеличения их количества.
texts.en: Kholli lives in the Shahrituz region. He is 56 years old and a widower. Together with his son and father, Kholli raises cattle at home. He breeds goats and sheep.  Kholli is taking this loan to purchase sheep and goats to increase his herd.

loans.use: to increase the size of his goats and sheep herd

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.en:
This is Eufemia, 37, resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Roger, a driver, and is mother to their children. She, together with her husband, manage their own household while operating their business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Eufemia oversees the operations of their jeepney (see footnote**) transportation business. She has a (14-16 person capacity) jeepney, which is paying boundary (daily quota) each day. Her regular customers are her neighbors and people in the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 1000 every day.

To help her continue the operations of her business, Eufemia is requesting a Php 20,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her jeepney. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Eufemia hopes to be able to expand soon. She also dreams that her children will finish their education. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.

** Curiously, Jeepneys have purely American origins. They were first used by American soldiers helping the Philippines throw off the invading Japanese. Filipino ingenuity, however, managed to see this vehicle as an opportunity to earn, and modified the Jeep into a 20-seater jeepney, open enough to provide adequate ventilation, sturdy for every day travel, and cheap enough to buy and maintain. Now, the jeepneys are one of the things that makes the Philippines truly Philippines.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the spare parts and maintenance of their jeepney unit

loans.name: Kudratullo

texts.ru: Кудратулло житель района Хуросон. Ему 54 года. Он женат. У него пятеро детей. Он занимается выращиванием овощей. В этой области Кудратулло имеет богатый опыт, он более тридцати лет занимается растениеводством. Кредит берет для посева помидоров и огурцов.
texts.en: Kudratullo lives in the Khuroson region. He is 54 years old, married, and has five children. Kudratullo is a vegetable farmer. He has been growing crops for over thirty years and has a wealth of experience in this area. Kudratullo is taking this loan for sowing tomatoes and cucumbers.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is 51 years old. She has three children aged between 16 and 19. With this loan, she wants to buy more bananas to sell. The profits from the business will be used to provide food for her family.

loans.use: buy bananas to resell

loans.name: Manushaqe

texts.en:
Manushaqe is a thirty-four-years-old married Egyptian woman from the ethnic community of Albania. She has four children ranging in age from sixteen to three years old, with one of them being intellectualy challenged.  All of her children go to the “Help for Children” Foundation (HFC) School that was founded in October 1998 with the support of the “Terre des Hommes” organization from Switzerland. The purpose of this project is to support marginalized and vulnerable children, their families and the communities where they live. I, the writer, came to know Manushaqe’s family through my sister who has been the children's teacher for the longest time now.

Manushaqe’s husband has been receiving governmental disability support and in addition, he has been making extra money by recycling and selling scrap metal. Every morning and evening, despite the heavy back pain, he goes to the city’s large trash bins to gather metal cans. However, the money he generates through both sources doesn’t seem to be enough to add a toilet and a sink to their existing one-room house where they all sleep, eat and stay. 

It is the first time for Manushaqe to request a Kiva loan via VisionFund Albania and she seeks very much the lenders' appreciation in this matter.

loans.use: add a toilet and a sink to her one-room house

loans.name: Luis Daniel

texts.es: Luis de 50 años, inició su negocio hace 10, en compañía de su madre, cuando procedente de Bogotá, la capital de Colombia, llegó a la ciudad  y emprendió una miscelánea como su punto comercial, mientras también distribuía mercancía él mismo por toda la ciudad entre clientes que le pagaban a crédito, con este negoció han logrado sustentar los gastos del hogar. El compra a un tercer comerciante, lo cual encarece sus costos y por eso su mercancía amerita un mayor esfuerzo comercial; su meta es lograr comprar directamente a los fabricantes, dejando a un lado la intermediación y la  disminución de sus costos, que lo llevarán a ser más competitivo. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que  hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará telas, calzado y ropa para damas caballeros y niños, sobre pedidos de sus clientes. Con su credikiva incrementará su capital de trabajo y logrará responderle una vez mas oportunamente a sus compradores, a quienes continua fidelizándolos con su amable y efectivo servicio comercial.Su mayor desafio ocurrió con su llegada a esta ciudad  en la que debío enfrentar la cultura Caribe, diferente a la cultura andina y adaptarse a las condiciones climaticas y del medio ambiente social, hoy puede sentirse muy cómodo pues ha logrado acceder a este mercado y tener posibilidades de expandirese y captar la potencial demanda existente.
texts.en: Luis is 50 years old.  He started his business ten years ago together with his mother when he arrived in this city from Bogotá, the capital of Colombia, and set up a general store as his sales location.  He also distributes merchandise all over the city to customers who pay on credit.  Through this business, he has managed to cover his household expenses.  Luis buys from a third party which raises his costs and so he needs to make more effort to sell his merchandise.  His goal is to be able to buy directly from manufacturers so that he can bypass the middlemen and lower his costs.  This would allow him to be more competitive.  Luis is currently applying for a Kiva loan (his first loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo) to buy fabric and also men's, women's and children's shoes and clothing to fill his customers' orders.  His Kiva loan will increase his working capital and he will be able to respond to his buyers in a more timely fashion.  His customers remain loyal to his business because of his kind, genuine service.  Luis faced his biggest challenge when he arrived in this city because he had to adjust to its Caribbean culture which is different from the Andean culture.  He had to adapt to a change in climate and a different social environment.  These days he feels very comfortable as he has managed to break into the market and has possibilities of expanding his business and capturing existing potential demand.

loans.use: to buy fabric as well as men's, women's and children's shoes and clothing

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is 20 years old and is from Gaza.  He started working as a tailor two years ago and started working for himself in 1/1/2012.

Mahmoud asked Ryada for this youth loan to buy a new sewing machine, an electricity generator, and a few shelves.  His ambition is to develop his work as a tailor and enlarge the space he works in to improve his income.

loans.use: buy a sewing machine, a generator, and shelves

loans.name: Heng's Group

texts.en:
Heng is a mother of six children.  She is 42 years old and lives in one of the remote area in Battambang Province. Heng has to support the entire household, especially all of her dependent children who are still in school.  She and her husband have been working on their two hectares of farmland to grow rice and on their six hectares to grow corn.  They  have been in this businesses 13 years already.  

As a farmer, Heng's main challenge is the inadequacy of financial support for her crops, which make her unable to have decent food and proper living conditions as others. She earns about two US dollars per day.

Heng joined VisionFund in 2002 for her first loan cycle.  Since then, she had taken additional loans and each loan was repaid back successfully.  In total, she received loans from VisionFund for eight cycles already and it has helped her to timely plant her crops, which has enabled her to receive more crop yield and improve her living condition. 

Heng has now formed a group with another member and they are requesting a loan of KHR 1,400,000 each. As the group leader, Heng will use her portion of of the loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, and hire labor to plow her rice farm and crop plantation. She hopes to earn more money and expand her current businesses.

loans.use: buy seeds, fertilizer and hire labor

loans.name: Jean Sauveur

texts.en: Jean Sauveur is 24 years old. He is single and has been taxi driver for one year. He requested this loan to make maintenance to his taxi/car. The profits from the business will be used to make savings.

loans.use: maintain his taxi

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 42 years old and is an enterprising business lady.  She is a widow with two children. She has been a dairy farmer as a primary business and running a boutique shop as a secondary business for the past seven years, with a monthly income of KES 30,000 which she uses to support her family. 

Lucy is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced by a KADET customer. Lucy will use the loan to buy animal feeds and a stock of new clothes for her shop.  With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to expand the boutique business and improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: buy animal feed and clothes to sell

loans.name: Fanny Melissa

texts.es:
Fanny tiene 22 años de edad, es soltera, vive con sus padres en una Colonia cercana que pertenece al sector López Arellano, del municipio de Choloma, Cortes.
Ella tiene tres años de dedicarse a la venta de ropa de todo tipo nueva y usada, de este negocio a podido pagar los gastos de estudio y ayudar a sus padres, y solicita un préstamo por 6,000.00 lempiras para comprar un fardo de ropa mixta para damas caballeros y niños y mantener surtido el negocio para aumentar las ventas y las ganancias. Este negocio lo tiene en su casa. Su meta es que el negocio crezca y con las utilidades continuar los estudios universitarios.
texts.en:
Fanny is 22 years old, single, and lives with her parents in a neighborhood near the sector of López Arellano, which is in the town of Choloma, Cortes.

She has been selling all types of new and used clothing for three years. This business has enabled her to pay for her educational expenses and also help her parents.

Fanny is requesting a loan of 6,000 HNL so that she can buy a bundle of mixed clothing for women, men, and children. This will restock her business so that she can increase her sales and her earnings. Her business is located at her house. Her goal is to grow her business and use the profits to continue her university studies.

loans.use: to buy a bundle of clothing for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy thread, hemp, stones, plastic toys and CDs

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana tiene 42 años de edad, pero tiene el espíritu de una joven de 20 años, su vivienda se ubica en el distrito de Parcona, el cual se caracteriza por la calidez de sus pobladores, asimismo se encuentra el bosque de piedras en el cual se puede apreciar formaciones rocosas en forma de personas, animales, entre otros. Ana es madre de 3 hijos a los cuales ha sacado adelante sola ya que su esposo la abandono.  Cuando Ana tiene un tiempo libre le gusta mucho ver televisión, en especial sus novelas favoritas, en ocasiones también le gusta comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es la riquísima “Carapulcra con sopa seca”. Debido a los pocos recursos económicos de sus padres Ana solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto grado de secundaria pero le hubiera gustado estudiar la carrera de administración.

Con mucho entusiasmo Ana trabaja en su negocio de venta de artículos para el hogar como planchas, ollas arroceras, platos, entre otros, ella trabaja en su negocio alrededor de 8 horas al día y puede atender hasta 15 clientes diariamente, ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable con los clientes.

Ana está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la gran ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mercadería para su negocio como platos, jarras, vasos, ollas, entre otros, lo cual le permitirá tener mayor variedad de productos ahora que se acerca temporada de fiestas patrias, lo cual mejorar sus ingresos y le permitirá ir mejorando su calidad de vida e ir en busca de hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener una gran tienda comercial y darle la mejor educación a sus hijos”.
texts.en:
Ana is 42 years old but has the spirit of a 20 year old.  Her home is located in Parcona district which is well known for the warmth of its residents.  It is also known for the 'bosque de piedras' (stone forest) where you can see rock formations in the shape of people, animals, etc.  Ana is the mother of three children who she has provided for on her own as her husband abandoned her.  Whenever Ana has any free time, she really enjoys watching television, especially her favorite soap operas.  She also enjoys eating one of her favorite dishes, the delicious 'carapulcra con sopa seca'.  Owing to her parents' lack of financial means, Ana was only able to study up to the fifth year of her secondary education.  However, she would have liked to have studied for a degree in Administration.  

Ana works in her business selling household goods such as irons, pans, rice cookers, plates etc with a lot of enthusiasm.  She works around 8 hours a day in her business and is able to serve up to 15 customers.  She believes that her business is doing well because she is very friendly with her customers.

Ana is very grateful to Kiva lenders because, thanks to their help, she will be able to buy merchandise for her business such as plates, jugs, cups, pans, etc.  This will allow her to have a wider range of products available with the 'patriotic holidays' period approaching.  She will be able to improve her income and also her quality of life.  She will be able to continue working towards fulfilling her biggest dream: to have a large store and provide her children with a better education.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (plates, jars, cups, pans, etc.)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy various goods such as clothes, shoes, umbrellas, bags, etc. for resale.

loans.name: 73-Las Orquideas.p. Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento 73-LAS ORQUIDEAS.P., está  compuesto por nueve integrantes siete mujeres y dos varónes,  la presidenta del banco es la Sra.  Tania  vive por la zona  de Los Chacos, La presidenta del banco en la foto esta con chompa blanca con líneas negras., pantalón negro y sandalias negras. Es la segunda comenzando por el lado derecho, ella tiene 31 años y dos hijos de las edades de 5 y 7 años, todos ellos en edad escolar, La Sra. Tania  se dedica a la venta de comida en su puesto de venta que se encuentra en la misma zona donde vive,  este préstamo es su segunda  secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Tania  va a usar este préstamo para compra de insumos por mayor como papa, arroz, fideo y aceite para la elaboración de sus comidas y así de esta manera incrementar su capital de trabajo,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, la Sra. Tania va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando insumos y así mejorando sus ingresos, su deseo para su negocio es tener un restaurante y así brindar mayor comodidad a su clientela. La Sra. tania es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada a ella y a sus compañeras de grupo ya que en algunos casos mantienen solas a sus familias.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “73-Las Orquideas.P” consists of nine members, seven women and two men. The president of the Communal Bank is Sra. Tania, who lives in the District of Los Chacos. In the photograph, Tania is wearing a sweater with black and white stripes, black pants, and black sandals. She is the second person standing, starting on the right side.

Sra. Tania is 31 years old and has two children, ages 5 and 7, both of whom are of in school. She sells food from a vending stall located in the same district where she lives. This loan is her second cycle with Emprender. Sra. Tania will use the money to buy supplies in bulk such as potatoes, rice, noodles, and oil for preparing her dishes. The loan will also increase her operating capital. Her reason for requesting this loan is so that she can continue improving her business. By utilizing the benefits of this loan, Sra. Tania will be able to continue buying supplies and improving her income. Her wish for her business is to open a restaurant where her customers can be more comfortable. Sra. Tania is a hardworking person who is happy with the opportunity that has been provided to her and her fellow group members. Some of them have sole responsibility for supporting their families.

loans.use: to buy supplies for preparing her dishes.

loans.name: José Leonel

texts.es: El Señor José tiene 29 años de edad, está casado tiene 1 hijo de 7 meses, reside en la comunidad de Cofradía en el Municipio de San Pedro Sula, Cortés. Don José trabajaba en un taller de enderezado y pintura de Vehículos, con esa experiencia decidió  hace más de 2 años por iniciativa propia y con sus propios ingresos instalar su propio taller brindando buen servicio y atención a sus clientes. Esta solicitando un segundo préstamo a ODEF y a KIVA por 15,000.00 Lempiras, está  muy agradecido por el préstamo anterior el cual le ayudo a la estabilidad económica y desarrollo del negocio y de su familia.  Con este préstamo va comprar materia prima como ser: flex gliden, pintura Robin, maskin tape, tiner etc. Para realizar mejor el trabajo de enderezado y pintura de los vehículos. El continúa con su sueño de hacer crecer el negocio brindando un buen servicio para llegar a ser una empresa grande en servicio automotriz.
texts.en:
Sr. José is 29 years old, married, and has a seven-month-old child. He resides in the community of Cofradía in the town of San Pedro Sula, Cortés.

Don José worked at a paint and body shop. Using his experience, he decided more than two years ago to generate his own income and open a repair shop where he provides good service and attention to his customers.

He is requesting a second loan from ODEF and Kiva in the amount of 15,000 HNL. José is very grateful for his previous loan, which helped him achieve financial stability and develop this business on behalf of his family. With this loan, he will buy waterproof coating, paint, masking tape, thinners, and other supplies so that he can improve his paint and body jobs. He will continue his dream of growing his business and providing good service so that he can turn it into a large automotive service company.

loans.use: to buy waterproof coating, paint, masking tape, thinners, and other supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy various goods such as beans, rice, sugar, umbrellas, bags, etc. for resale.

loans.name: Luciano Eduardo

texts.es:
LUCIANO EDUARDO tiene 55 años de edad de estado civil unión libre tiene 3 hijos, vive con la esposa y con los hijos en Ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC LUCHA Y PROGRESO, sus miembros se dedican a la agricultura todos viven en el sector del recinto el Progreso prácticamente se han criado en esa zona.

LUCIANO EDUARDO se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz. Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, urea, abono orgánico y quiímico. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario para los cultivos.

Las compras y las ventas lo hace en Ventanas. El sueño es poder comprar terreno para sembrar más. En el tiempo libre le gusta viajar.
texts.en:
Luciano Eduardo is 55 years old, he lives in a common-law marriage with his partner, he has 3 children and they all live together in Ventanas, in the Los Ríos province.

He is a member of the Communal Bank Lucha y Progreso (Fight to Progress) whose members are farmers and all live in the Progreso Community where most of them grew up.

Luciano Eduardo is a farmer and he grows corn. He is requesting a loan to buy seeds, urea, manure and fertilizers. Thanks to the loan he will succeed in buying everything he needs for his crops.

He buys his supplies and sells in Ventanas. He dreams of succeeding in buying some land to grow more corn. He likes travelling in his free time.

loans.use: To buy seeds, urea, manure and fertilizers.

loans.name: Myriam

texts.es: Myriam, tiene la edad  de 50 años, está divorciada,  vive con su hijo el cual es su mayor prioridad. Ella con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de una máquina de coser, la cual le facilite la elaboración de ciertas costuras que le den un mejor acabado a las prendas fabricadas, además de aumentar la cantidad de unidades confeccionadas. Con esta compra pretende hacer más ropa y así cumplir con los pedidos a corto plazo. De esta manera tener más ingresos con el objetivo de poder invertir más en matería prima. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Myriam is 50 years old and divorced; she lives with her son, who is her highest priority. 

With this loan, she intends to purchase a sewing machine that will facilitate the sewing of certain seams, giving a better finish to the garments she makes in addition to increasing the number of pieces made. With this purchase, she expects to produce more clothing and thus complete her orders in a short time frame. That way, she will have more income, with the objective of being able to invest in more raw materials. 

This is the first loan that Myriam has received from FUDECOSUR. She had not had other loans with state banks before, but FUDECOSUR has offered her the loan with greater simplicity and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine.

loans.name: Santa Julia

texts.es:
Con 62,100 pesos Santa podrá comprar equipos para la cocina de su puesto de venta de comida y así realizar un trabajo más eficiente con menos esfuerzo físico.  Todos los que conocen a Santa siempre le decian lo rico que cocina. Así que hace ocho años decidió probar suerte e iniciar su puesto de venta de comida. Desde entonces tiene clientes fijos que escogen desayunar o almorzar todos los dias en su comedor. 
Santa es casada y su esposo vende melones al por mayor en el mercado local. Tienen 6 hijos entre 26 y 9 años, todos trabajan, pues ya son mayores de edad, menos la de 9 años que asiste a la escuela.
Santa quiere ver crecer cada día su negocio para poder comprar su casa propia y dejar de pagar alquiler.
texts.en:
With this loan of 62,100 DOP, Santa will be able to buy cooking equipment for her food stall so that she can work more efficiently and with less physical effort. Everyone who knows Santa always rave about the flavor of the food she prepares. Eight years ago, she decided to try her luck at opening a food stall. Since then, she has acquired regular customers who come to her eatery every day to have breakfast or lunch.

Santa is married and her husband sells melons in bulk at the local market. They have six children between the ages of 9 and 26. All of the grown children work and the nine-year-old attends school. Santa wants to grow each day in her business so that she can buy a house of her own and stop paying rent.

loans.use: to buy cooking equipment for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy inventory for her pharmacy.

loans.name: Fidel Antonio

texts.es:
Fidel, está iniciando su cultivo de maíz, para lo cual deberá comprarse los insumos agrícolas que le permitan cultivar, el maíz y pipián de la temporada, como lo es el abono, herbicidas, semillas, que le permitirá a él poder iniciar el trabajo en agricultura.
Él préstamo anterior logró mejorar cosechas pues obtuvo una buena producción que le permitió comercializar y generar para su familia ingresos, estabilizando su condición como agricultor.
texts.en:
Fidel is beginning his cultivation of corn, for which he will need to buy himself agricultural inputs that allow him to grow corn and pipián (seasonal squash).  These will include fertilizers, herbicides, and seeds that will permit him to begin his agricultural work.

The loan before allowed him to improve his harvests and obtain a good yield that will permit him to sell his products and generate income for his family, while establishing himself as a farmer.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, herbicides, and seeds.

texts.es: Nelson de 54 años de edad con su anterior credikiva compró artículos de ferretería y rotó rápidamente su mercancía, porque sus ventas se incrementaron con los productos comprados que fueron los de mayor consumo de sus clientes. En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva con el cual comprará productos de ferretería, tales como cables, hierro y cemento, aprovechando que el sector de la construcción se ha reactivado y Nelson quiere aprovechar el potencial de clientes que este genera y con ello ganar un poco mas de dinero. Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente: “Les agradezco la colaboración por brindarme la oportunidad de seguir progresando en mi negocio y espero me sigan apoyando”
texts.en:
Nelson is 54 years old and with his previous Kiva loan, he bought hardware products and quickly ran through his merchandise because his sales increased with the products he bought, which were those most often consumed by his customers.  Currently, he is looking for a new loan with which to buy new hardware  products, such as cables, iron, and cement, taking advantage of the fact that the construction business has been reinvigorated and Nelson wishes to take advantage of the potential for new customers that this will generate and thereby gain a little more income.  

His message to the financiers of Kiva is the following, "I thank you for the assistance and the opportunity to continue making progress with my business and I hope you will continue to help me."

loans.name: Rosa Hilda

texts.es:
Rosa, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo con la intención de mejorar su negocio, dándole el fortalecimiento necesario, se comprará pollos de engorde y pequeños para la granja y también concentrado para alimentarlos, esto le ayudará a mejorar su condición en el negocio y a aumentar el número de pollos para la comercialización.
Ella manifiesta que el préstamo anterior le ha ayudado para mantenerse en el negocio,con una granja mas adecuada, con un número adecuado de pollos en su granja, que le ha permitido poder generar ventas a los clientes y mantener lo necesario para su familia.
texts.en:
Rosa is asking for a new loan with the intention of improving her business, giving her the necessary strengthening of her business.  She will buy chickens to fatten and little ones for her farm, and also feed to nourish them.  This will help her to improve her business conditions and to increase the number of chickens she can sell.

She reports that the previous loan has helped her to stay in business, with a more suitable farm, and with enough chickens on her farm that she has been able to generate sales to her customers and maintain an income for her family's necessities.

loans.use: to buy chickens and chicken feed.

loans.name: Ana Julieta

texts.es:
Ana, esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo para poderlo invertir en la sorbetería, se comprará helados de diferentes sabores sorbetes, paletas, conos, que le ayudarán para ofrecerle a los clientes un surtido de calidad en sorbetería. 
Ella manifiesta que el préstamo anterior le ayudó para mejorar el negocio, superándose con mayor crecimiento en mercadería y en ventas, el número de clientes también han aumentado y así son oportunidades para ir desarrollándose en el negocio.
texts.en:
Ana is asking for a new loan in order to invest in her sorbet shop.  She will buy ice creams of different flavors, as well as sorbets, popsicles, and cones, which will help her to offer her customers a full, quality experience in her sorbet shop.

She says that her previous loan helped her to improve her business, acheiving a better growth in her market share and in her sales, the number of clients has also increased and thus she has more opportunity to continue improving her business.

loans.use: to buy popsicles, cones, and different flavors of sorbets.

loans.name: Maria Consuelo

texts.es:
María, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo porque necesita invertir en el negocio comprándose más mercadería para la tienda, cereales, pastas, arroz, frutas como bananos, fresas, entre otros que son necesarios para la clientela, este préstamo ayudará a mantener un buen nivel y mantenerse estable con sus clientes.
El efecto que tuvo con el préstamo anterior ha sido favorable, pues le ha permitido aumentar su clientela, su negocio se ha encontrado más surtido de productos, considerándose una superación en el negocio de María, también ha aportado una mayor ganancia a su familia y de estos ingresos también se logró comprar una refrigeradora.
texts.en:
María is asking for a new loan because she needs to invest in her business by buying new merchandise for her store, like grains, pasta, rice, and fruits like bananas and strawberries, among others, which are necessary for her customers.  This loan will help her to maintain a good level of supplies and keep her business in a stable state for her customers.

The effect that was had with her previous loan was favorable, since it allowed her to increase her customer base, her store has been better supplied with products, and this has been considered by María to be a success for her business.  She has also had a greater profit for her family's income, and with this income she was able to buy a refrigerator.

loans.use: to buy grains, pasta, rice, and fruits like bananas and strawberries.

loans.name: Koeju Group

texts.es:
Koeju está integrado por 20 mujeres de la ciudad de luque, quienes se esfuerzan siempre lo mas para poder ayudar a sus familias.
La Sra. Maria se dedica a la venta de comestibles,  esta casada con el señor Roberto con quien tiene 3 hijos. Ella solicita el credito  para la compra de una cocina electrica para ganar mas tiempo y comodiad en la elaboracion de sus comestibles.
